campaign.story:
Pixels are the coolest dice you’ve ever seen! Full of LEDs, smarts and no larger than regular dice, they can be customized to light up when and how you desire. Incredibly strong, smooth and sharp, they work for several hours at a time, after which you can simply recharge them with the accompanying case. Pixels know which way they roll and can communicate with your phone or tablet via Bluetooth. This means they will work with Roll20, Foundry or any one of your favorite online platforms.
PLAY

Depending on the design you select, the LED lights will either shine through the entire face (Midnight Galaxy and Aurora Sky) or only through the numbers (Onyx Black and Hematite Grey).
PLAY

Because of all the electronics and the battery, Pixels tend to be slightly heavier than regular dice of the same size. As a result they feel really nice in your hands, sound like proper dice, without being nearly as heavy as metal dice.
Aurora Sky Pixel next to a few other types of dice
We’ve put a lot of effort in Pixels to make sure they are just as easy and convenient to use as regular dice. We’re really excited to have been able to fit all the electronics inside such small packages.
Onyx Black Set next to other types of dice.
PLAY

Dice are made to be rolled, tossed, thrown and dropped. Fortunately, Pixels are really strong and don’t expect you to be careful handling them; all the electronics are encased in very tough resin. Your Pixels will last for many years!
Because Pixels are cast in resin, there are no screws, no flaps, no parting lines anywhere; the dice are perfectly smooth! Programming and recharging the dice are both taken care of wirelessly, a significant technical challenge in such a small form factor, but one that we strongly believe was worth it!
 In fact, Pixels are fully waterproof! :)
Pixels are, above all, great dice for your table games. This means that balance and fair rolls are just as important to us as all the fancy electronics inside. We have dedicated a lot of time, design and testing to make sure they are as fair as possible. With a combination of small counterweights and precise attention to the finish of our edges, we’ve already made Pixels surprisingly well balanced. And of course we will continue to improve the balance before release.
PLAY

Fairness comparison with well-known brands (Comparison Data Credit of Mark Fickett)
Pixels speak Bluetooth. This is how the companion app communicates with the dice to reprogram them. It is also how the dice communicate back with the app to report what you rolled. In this early version of the app, we use the functionality to have your phone play sound effects based on your rolls.
PLAY

However the Bluetooth protocol used by the dice isn’t proprietary, and many other apps will be able to talk directly to the dice as well. We are already in talks with D&D Beyond, Roll20, Foundry, and a few others to integrate Pixels directly.
PLAY

And while the dice can connect to your phone or computer for extra fancy features, that is not at all a requirement. Once you’ve customized your Pixels, you can put your phone away and just use them for as long as you want. Or until you get tired of the color scheme and decide to try something new ;)

It was very important to us that Pixels be ‘dice’ first and foremost, and that design philosophy extends to the software side of things as well. They are just as easy to use as any other dice. Just pick them up, roll them, and they’ll light up! That’s it.
The dice use a small rechargeable battery. The battery, while absolutely tiny compared to a typical cell phone, is large enough to power the dice for several hours. In fact, in our tests, we’ve averaged 5 hours of use on a single charge. And if you only use Bluetooth but don't have the dice light up, then you can easily record more than 20,000 rolls on a single charge (Check out the video in the Balance section).
PLAY

Once your session is over, Pixels will recharge conveniently in the accompanying case. Every single Pixel will come with its own charging case, and every set will come with a larger one.
Place the die in its case. Make sure the highest face is up (20 in the case of the D20) and it will recharge in an hour or so.
The lid of the case contains a small magnet that will prevent the dice from turning on and lighting up during transport. Don’t get us wrong, glowing pockets are cool and all, but not being able to flex your flashy dice isn’t; we wouldn’t wish that on anyone.
Battery Voltage over ~1000 rolls.
The To-Go case next to the standard individual case.
Any 7-dice set you get will come with a To-Go carrying case. This larger case has its own battery, and room for 8 dice. It will be able to recharge all your dice 2 or 3 times before needing to be recharged itself. Great for when you are not necessarily close to an outlet or if you just want to keep your dice topped-up while you play.
PLAY

The case will let you carry any set of dice. Want a full set? No problem. Need to have 8D6 for some reason? You got it! The case and individual chargers both use the same insert system, so you can customize the dice layout as much as you want.
PLAY

Pixels are completely customizable. Thanks to the accompanying app, you are in control of how the dice light up. Want to create a quick colored theme? No problem! Prefer a colorful set of patterns instead. Go right ahead! Using the accompanying app, you can control exactly how the dice light up and when.
PLAY

Using a Condition -> Action system (similar to IFTTT) you can describe exactly under what condition you want the dice to light up or even your phone to play sounds (if connected).
PLAY

At any time you can easily preview your creation directly on a die and make sure the result is exactly what you want.
Roll20, Foundry and D&D Beyond are all working with us to ensure Pixels are supported on their platforms.
We are also discussing potential integration with Fantasy Grounds.
In addition to the planned Official Integrations, we are committed to keeping the Pixels' API completely Open Source and available on Github.
All of Pixels Software and Firmware code is available on GitHub.
This means that even if we are not supporting your favorite platform directly, you will be able to use 3rd party integrations, or even better, write your own.

Pixels will allow developers to write their own apps, and do that even for commercial purposes. If you are interested in writing games / apps / integrations that use Pixels, consider one of our limited Devkit D20 Addons.
If you are a developer, grab one of the D20 Devkit Addons and receive a sample shortly after the campaign ends.
Although every Pixel can be used as a Dev Kit, if you grab one of those addons, you will receive an Early D20 so you can get a head start on development.
Pixels are not only Open Source, but also Open Hardware! Pixels wouldn’t exist without the open-source and open-hardware communities, and so we think it the right thing to do to share our work as well.
Pixels Design Files are also Open Source
Most of the design files are already available on Pixels Hackaday.io project page, along with multiple prior prototypes and documentation of our adventures getting to the final versions of the dice.
The "core" of a D20 Pixel
If you are interested in using Pixels, have a question or suggestion for future updates, or just want to show your support, stop by our Discord!
This is also the place were we tend to share the most up-to-date developments. 

Pixels have also appeared in the following publications:
Pixels use RGB LEDs that are individually controlled to give you the most flexibility possible. Choose dice that will either glow entirely (brighter overall), or only through the numbers (more readable when lit) and let your creativity decide how they light up. 
Click on the image below to check out high-res pictures of all the available designs.
Head over to the Pixels website to see High-Resolution pictures.

Can't quite find the exact combination of dice you need? Add one or two more singles to your pledge. 
 Eager to start integrating Pixels with your app? Grab one of the limited Early Devkits!
All the rewards consist of a combination of Single dice and 7-dice sets. For instance, if you pledge at the 1 Die level, you get 1 single die. If you pledge at the Set level, you get 1 set. If you go for a 2 Set + 2 Dice, you get 2 sets and 2 singles. What those singles and sets are is up to you! You get to pick the size and design of each.
If you are not able to get exactly the combination you want from the rewards, we will also offer Addons. Want a Standard Set with 2 extra dice? No problem: Back at the Byte level and tack on an extra Single die! All Addons will ship at the same time as your rewards.

Not sure which level to back at? Here are some suggestions:
Please note that the rates below are estimates, exact shipping costs will depend on your country and shipping speed.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is the first physical product that we will be bringing to market, so there is no question that many challenges are still ahead of us. This is why we have been working with a manufacturing partner to help us through the process and pair us with reputable and reliable manufacturers. At this point, we have two manufacturers lined up and able to begin production.

Based on the feedback we got from factories, we expect to ship rewards in 12 months. However, please understand that this is an estimate. While we hope start delivering rewards sooner, we fully expect to have many issues along the way, no matter how hard we try to avoid them, and so it possible that it will take us longer to finish production. After all, getting this far was anything but easy and there is no reason to think that things should change during production! :)

We are, however, committed to making Pixels a reality and to keep the entire process transparent. This was a passion project before it was a product, and seeing the excitement spread throughout the community has almost given us a sense of duty to making flashy-connected-dice happen in the open. We think they are amazing, and we want to put them in your hands!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello everyone! Time for our monthly update. It’s another long one so TL;DR this will address the following topics: Brand update, PledgeManager information, factory visits, DevKit status, app status, and optional form results. We’ll aim to always put the topics covered in the update title so you can see at a glance if it’s something you’re interested in.
Many items are updates on things that were mentioned in the May 2021 update. Please make sure you review that one for information on how Kickstarter works, our future plans, existing scams, and a few other topics.

Hello everyone! I’m here with our first major update since the campaign ended just over one month ago. We have lots of information for you, so this will be a big one!

Logo: Kickstarter
Kickstarter Basics

Just a quick note to say it once again: Thank you! We reached the last stretch goal with a full 8 minutes to spare. :)
What an incredible way to finish this campaign, I was almost more anxious watching this than I was when I hit the Launch button 30 days ago! :)
By the way, if you're a backer, you should have received a separate email with a small gift from me.

Just a bit under 24 hours to go in the campaign!
Thank you so much for your support so far, it's just incredible to see this amount of excitement for shiny math rocks! I think we're going to make the last Stretch Goal, but it's going to be really close. So tell you friends, tell your grandparents, tell your pets, tell that one childhood friend you've always meant to reconnect with but never did... :) Tell everyone! We can make it!

Black / White cases poll results
We've ran the numbers and we can confidently say that...

As we're approaching the 3M mark, it is a good time for a significant progress update!

$3M Stretch Goal reveal...
To celebrate the upcoming $3 Million milestone, we are super pleased to add Fate/Fudge dice to the selection!!!

campaign.story:
IMPORTANT ANNOUNCEMENT: Thanks for your interest in THE DEAD SEA SQUIRRELS. In the few days since our Kickstarter campaign launched we've had potential investors come forward to fund the series.  Everyone is committed to Mike Nawrocki’s vision and agrees he should retain creative control over the series’ content — which was our main reason for choosing Kickstarter vs. traditional investor funding.  As a result, we are suspending this Kickstarter campaign and hope to have more great news to share with you soon.
For all the latest updates and exclusive clips, please join our mailing list at www.deadseasquirrels.com.  And for more information on potential investment opportunities and/or for general questions, please email us at info@deadseasquirrels.com.

THE STORY:
It's a squirrelly age we're living in... and we need new heroes. THE DEAD SEA SQUIRRELS tells the story of Merle and Pearl, two 1st century squirrels from Israel who’ve been preserved in sea salt in a cave alongside the Dead Sea. When 10-year-old Michael discovers them 2000 years later and sneaks them home in his backpack, hijinks ensue after this salty couple reanimate and take their new friend on adventures full of action, humor, music, and character-building lessons. 
 I'm Steve Taylor, and as producer of The Dead Sea Squirrels I've convinced my longtime friend Mike Nawrocki that Kickstarter is the best way to fund it. Why? Because it's way more fun building a community on Kickstarter than pitching the concept to soulless entertainment conglomerates who would then become Mike's boss. And besides boatloads of money, what have they got that we don't? So put your paws together and let's bring The Dead to life!
Here's Mike to tell us more... 
When I co-created VeggieTales with Phil Vischer in 1993, I never imagined the impact our stories and characters would still be having three decades later. From Silly Songs with Larry and 3-2-1 Penguins! to our theatrical movies Jonah and The Pirates Who Don’t Do Anything, it’s been quite a ride. But I’ve always dreamed of launching another series that taught biblical values in an entertaining way… and maybe this time featuring characters with actual arms and legs and… paws?
Enter The Dead Sea Squirrels, my new book series that launched in 2019. The response has been incredible, with Book One now in its third printing. I knew all along I wanted the stories in these books to come alive through animation, and to create another resource for parents to get their kids excited about the Bible.
 But animation is expensive, and (despite what the internet says about my very inflated net worth) I don’t have anywhere near the financial resources to fund a new series myself. In fact, I’m currently making a living as a professor at Lipscomb University in Nashville, Tennessee — where I teach film and animation in our excellent School of Theatre and Cinematic Arts. What to do?
My colleague Steve Taylor — who continues to make music and films while overseeing our school — had an idea. What if our animation program, founded by renowned Disney animator Tom Bancroft, created the series with us? Tom and his faculty of professional animators could work alongside our top students (who we would pay to work while they're still in school), and the combination would create world-class animation.
Tom Bancroft with students in Lipscomb's Animation lab
Lipscomb Animation major Zoe Fitzhugh on the job.
 Then we could partner with our friends at Mukpuddy Studios in New Zealand to beautifully craft much of the final animation. 
And as a bonus, each episode would feature an original song — assuming you like all those Silly Songs I’ve written through the years — like this one I wrote with Steve... 
PLAY

How do we know this will work? Because we’re weeks away from finishing the pilot episode. It was funded by some generous donors who asked, “Can you pull this off?”
Yes we can.
Wanna make history as a Founding Backer who brought The Dead Sea Squirrels to life?
Even better, wanna see what it’s gonna look like? 
PLAY

PLAY

But wait! There's more! While the majority of your donation goes to producing the series, we've lovingly crafted these soon-to-be-priceless collectibles as a thank you for your generosity, including...
To commemorate your role in bringing "The Dead" to life, we'll personalize this official certificate with your name or the name of a loved one and email it to you as a .pdf file. And unlike a college diploma, this one comes with minimal debt.
Because stickers go with everything: laptops, mirrors, sleeping foreheads..

 When worn in public, this functions as: 1) a secret handshake between backers (without the need for a post-shake hand sanitizer); or 2) a conversation starter that typically begins with, "Why is there a dead squirrel on your lapel?"
The traditional "Dead Sea Squirrels" design features our ready-for-adventure cast of characters posed deep inside a mysterious cave. 
The less traditional "We're Not Dead Yet!" design — available in black and pink — is sure to turn heads and prompt questions like, "Are those squirrel skeletons on your shirt?" and "Why are there squirrel skeletons on your shirt?"
All shirts available in Youth sizes XS, S, M  & L and Adult sizes S, M, L, XL & 2XL
 We've assembled the first six books of the series into a boxed set that is being offered exclusively to our backers and will be lovingly signed by author Mike Nawrocki. And as a special bonus, we're including the time to read them.
We've hired Master Plush-maker Gregory Autore to design life-sized (10") Merle and Pearl plushies so adorable that you may want to get them insured. (Merle shown above. Pearl is still being lovingly crafted.)

 Because if you pledge for the Complete Squirrel Works package, wouldn't you feel cheated if it didn't arrive in its own nut case?

 Are these premium perks more expensive? They sure are! But if you've squirrelled away a few extra (metaphorical) nuts this season, you could do worse than use them to teach and delight children.
High quality animation is expensive, and depending on the studio and the content it can cost from $10,000/minute to over $1mil/minute. With the help of our faculty, students, and our partners at Mukpuddy Animation Studio, we've reduced those costs to make our series more affordable. But we need your help to make it happen!
Our goal for the first 6 episodes (approx. 22 minutes each) is $1.2 million. 
PLAY

And what if we exceed our goal? Do we dare dream even bigger?  Of course we do! We’ve got a total of thirteen episodes planned (Mike is currently writing Book #10), so if we hit the "stretch goal" of $2.88mil, we can fund an entire thirteen episode series!
 And here’s a sneak peak at the stories for the first six episodes: 
 And now for your Soon To Be Frequently Asked Questions:
 What if you exceed your goal? We make more episodes! We’ve got a total of thirteen episodes planned (I’m currently writing Book #10). If we hit the goal of $2.88mil, we could fund an entire thirteen episode series!
 Let’s get crazy and think even bigger: what if this campaign succeeds beyond your wildest dreams? We like the way you’re thinking! More money allows us to up the quality even further on each episode, and adding to the workforce allows us to speed up our timeline.
 Speaking of timeline… what’s the timeline? Once we reach our goal we’ll immediately begin work on Episode Two. The plan is to produce a new episode every sixteen weeks, with the first six episode series ready to launch in Fall 2022. But if our campaign blows up and we’re able to fund the entire thirteen episode series and beyond, we can use the additional funds to expand our team and speed up the timeline.
 Don’t you want the series to be seen by as many people as possible? Yes we do, which is why we hope to land The Dead Sea Squirrels on a streaming platform or network to introduce it to the widest possible audience. But as beloved backers who are “bringing The Dead to life,” you’ll be the first to see the pilot episode, along with other sneak peeks and exclusive content for our backers. 
 Isn't it true that most networks and streaming platforms want to own what they present? Yes it is, and when a network puts up the money to have a series made, they ultimately have control over its content and messages. We’re hoping to negotiate licenses to other broadcast and streaming platforms, but the main reason for funding the series through Kickstarter is that it will allow us creative control over these stories so we don’t compromise on quality or biblical content.
 As a backer, when will I get to see the episodes? We’ll send you a secret link to the pilot episode as soon as it’s finished in April of this year. But we don’t want to release individual episodes until the series is finished and ready to premier on a streaming platform (i.e. Amazon, Netflix, YouTube, etc.).
 What if I don't have access to that particular streaming platform? Great question... and we don't know the answer. For those who can't access the series, we'll do our best to negotiate with our distribution partner for some sort of "backers only" access portal (for the $25 and up level). Or maybe there's a DVD release in our future (since evidently that's still a thing). But since we don't know who our distribution partner will be at this point, we can only guarantee that you'll have access to the pilot.
 Tell me more about your partners. What is Lipscomb University? We’re a Christian university here in Nashville, Tennessee, and our College of Entertainment and the Arts is rare within Christian higher education as it is situated in the heart of one of the top creative capitals in America, with access to some of the best entertainment industry veterans. Let us name-drop a little: our School of Music is directed by Grammy Award-winning producer Brown Bannister, our Animation program's founder is Disney animator Tom Bancroft, Steve Taylor leads our School of Theatre and Cinematic Arts, and our faculty is full of top practitioners in their field. (We’re so connected that Steve Martin even gave our theatrical performance of his musical Bright Star a shout-out.) Here's a testimonial from storyboard artist Naomi Bethel, who was one of the first to graduate from our Animation program...
“I had a blast working on the storyboarding team. As a Lipscomb Animation grad, collaborating with my professors and former classmates was really special.”
                                                                                                         — Naomi Bethel

campaign.story:
The twelve stories contained in this volume introduce the reader to the world of Hibaria and the Islands. It is a world of magic and mystery, of dragons and sea serpents, a world where the Sky Lords - the Constellations - can take physical form and walk the land. It is a world in which an ancient evil, long imprisoned, threatens to break free.
The central characters in these stories are children and young adults who grapple with fear and sorrow, loss and longing, and who are given the opportunity to choose courage and hope. Their individual stories weave together to begin to tell a larger narrative. 
This full-color volume is as much a book of stories as it is an art book: it is brimming with richly painted illustrations, numerous supplemental sketches, and finely detailed maps. Here is a sampling of page spreads and images included in the book:
Want to hear a sample of one of the stories? Click below to play an excerpt from The Snow Beast.
This project has consumed my life for the better part of a year. As the world of Hibaria has developed in my mind and come more into focus, I've grown more excited by what I see, which has increased my enthusiasm and spurred this project forward. I have been driven by the desire to create a book that will further make sense of and bring life to this tangle of ideas that have, until now, only existed as painted images.
And so I have spent countless hours writing and re-writing, fine-tuning histories and maps, and making sketches. When not working on it, I have thought about it - how to make it better.
I'm proud of the fruit of these labors and am so excited to share it with you. With your help, we can bring this project to life. 
This will be a hardcover, 8.5"x11" book. The stories and appendices together total over 120 pages. The audience is 12 years and up. 
I live in Wichita, Kansas with my wife and three children. I do creative work for a living. I primarily paint narrative images infused with fantastical elements, and write stories to go along with my paintings. I sell my work online, in galleries, and at art festivals and fairs throughout the Midwest.
I am the author and illustrator of Ellen and the Winter Wolves. I also illustrated The Wishes of the Fish King by Douglas Kaine McKelvey and helped McKelvey create Stories We Shared: A Family Book Journal. All these projects were funded through Kickstarter campaigns.
Here are the different reward descriptions. And if you don't see a print you were hoping to see, never fear! Keep on scrolling till you see the Additional Items Through the Add-on Store section. After the campaign, you'll be able to get any combination of the prints, maps, and books there!
Star Chart, Map, and Reproduction
Original Paintings

There are pledges that include a reproduction, the map, and the star chart, but I understand that many of you will want more choices. For this reason, after the campaign is complete I will collect your shipping information through a Backerkit survey. Here you'll have the opportunity to add any number of the following items to your pledge: 
You are welcome to add any additional funds to your Kickstarter pledge to account for add-on items, but you will have the opportunity to checkout again at the end of your survey, in the event that you purchase additional items and have a remaining balance.
There might need to be slight adjustments along the way, but delivery by Christmas is my goal!
Just a note: Tariffs on this book look to be high. Instead of covering it by raising the pledge levels by $5 per book, I've decided to absorb this cost myself. I love this project and want it in the world and don't want to make it cost prohibitive for you, even if it means I don't make much on it. I mean that. However, if you'd like to contribute toward the tariff, you'll have an opportunity to do so at the end of the campaign. Any amount would be greatly appreciated!
This campaign would not be possible without the support of friends and family. Paul and Kyra Hinton have generously given me so much help thinking through and setting up this Kickstarter. The add-on store? Paul's idea. Pretty much everything behind the scenes? Paul's involved. The cool book mock-up? Kyra did it. The images of the maps and paintings hanging on the wall that allow you to envision my art in your home? Once again, Kyra. Kyra also agreed to put my video together for me (because I was overwhelmed with life) WHILE SHE WAS LAUNCHING A SALE OF HER OWN. Paul and Kyra, you guys are gold.
Lisa, thanks for giving me extra time to work on this. You've seen my stress and worry and freak outs and instead of getting annoyed you've consistently asked, "How can I help? Do you need to work late? Do you need to work this weekend?" You've kept the children out of my studio (which is no easy task) and given me everything I need to get this Kickstarter ready for launch. Thank you, dear wife.

campaign.story:
This latest project is admittedly a departure of sorts for me. "Earth Has No Sorrow" is a six-song hymns EP. Some friends and patrons invited me to record "Come Thou Fount" for an episode of their Chicago-based podcast, The Bridge. I enjoyed it, and was encouraged to assemble a few more, and release them. Having only sporadically attended church growing up, my familiarity with hymnody is admittedly shallow, but as an artist-songwriter drawn to honest, rich, genuine lyrics, it is not terribly difficult to see just how extraordinary and profound are so many of these songs. Like psalms, hymns speak for and to us, especially when our own energy, heart, mind, or words are sapped or even empty. Their gift to us is to remind and to advocate. Though this collection of songs is not my typical offering, I do hope they will reveal some part of me, and in the process be something pleasant, a balm.
UPDATE: In the tornado that ripped through East Nashville on March 3rd, Eric lost his home and studio. Thankfully, the songs for this project were near completion, and though the release may be delayed slightly, all rewards will still be delivered. Given the circumstances, and in order to release as soon as possible, we are removing the stretch goal "reward" of adding an original hymn to the project. Thank you for your support of Eric's work. It is enormously encouraging!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The risk? "Gee, swell, yet another artist is releasing a hymns, or 'worship,' record." If you've followed my music career for any length of time, you have no doubt surmised that church worship-type songs are not necessarily my wheelhouse. But I hope this humble collection of hymns with fresh arrangements is enough to remind you you are seen, loved, and you are enough. Also, since I haven’t released new music in four years, I hope you don't forget me. 

The songs are all ready to be finalized, and I expect to be able to release them within a couple of months of funding. 

As with all Kickstarter campaigns, if the goal is not fully funded by the end date, all the money disappears (i.e., your card will not be charged), and life goes on.

Cheers, and thank you for considering backing my project.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Thanks to all of you, we hit our goal with 1/2 of the campaign remaining!
So...
STRETCH GOAL: 4K - A covers ep (free to all backers) - This will be songs that I've been singing at soundcheck and in my living room for years. Music that helps to prepare my heart for worship. If you ever want to hear me try to do Dylan or Springsteen justice, this is your chance!
I’ll get right to it. My objective at this point in my career is simple: I want to create resources that serve the Church, the capital-C Church. As a worship leader in a local congregation and as a contributor and curator of content for Worship Leader Magazine, I recognize the importance of amplifying the voices of particular communities; and am committed to listening and responding. This record is a love letter to the Church, reminiscing all of the good it has done for me, ways it has inspired me, taken care of me, given me a place to belong; while also looking forward to and setting the course for what lies ahead of us.
Album Cover
I’ll Wait For You, My Love is a full-length album of new, old songs. All of the lyrics were written over a hundred years ago which gives them lilt and charm even as they display weighty theological and doctrinal truth. The melodies are modern and winsome; written to be simple enough to pick up quickly and substantial enough to have staying power. 
The ultimate vision is for the music to be used congregationally; offering words and melody to the prayers of the people. The songwriting, performances, and production all support that objective. 
As in all of my previous work, I value emotional verity very highly; both in the genesis  of the songs and in the performances (I believe God is honored by this, and desires to be worshipped in spirit and in truth.) I'll Wait For You, My Love is certainly not an exception. These songs give words and movement to my prayers. They offer inspiration, challenge, and consolation; and I want to share those gifts with you.
Softly And Tenderly...
During the recording, I’ve been joined by a bunch of generous and gifted artists as well as a dream band comprised of some of Nashville’s most talented players. The musicianship on this record is truly remarkable.
Contributors (so far):
Jason Gray

In the studio...
The record is well underway at this point. The creation process is probably about 80% completed. That being said, over the last couple of years, I’ve adopted the perspective that the release, promotion, and propagation of a record should be invested in as seriously as the creation. With I'll Wait For You, My Love, I want to be able to spend resources (time, creative energy, finances) being bold and courageous about sharing the music that I have been so intentional and thoughtful in making (even if that is the most vulnerable part.)
I’ll Wait For You, My Love will be released on 04.03.20
Here’s a tentative release schedule:
First Single  (Blessed Be The Name) - 01.24.20
First Single Remix (Blessed Be The Name) - 02.07.20
Second Single (Doxology feat. Mission House) - 02.14.20
Second Single Remix (Doxology) - 02.21.20
Third Single (TBD) - 03.06.20
Album - 04.03.20
The full-length digital download will be exclusively available to Kickstarter backers on 03.20.20. 
Here’s the deal: I’m an independent artist, but I also produce music for a living. This means that I have already paid for a lot of the costs that most artists incur in making a record. Stuff like studio rental, engineering, production, mixing, and mastering are already “covered” by me. That being said, there is still a substantial amount of money that goes out in the process. That money covers: 
Compensation for musicians/contributors
Remixes
Album art
Making physical product
Advertising/Promotion
So, what I’m saying is, when you pay for these rewards, you're buying an album–of course–but you're also making albums like this possible. I genuinely need your help to make this happen.
BIO
Greg LaFollette has been involved in more than one hundred records in his career. He has worked with Andrew Peterson, Audrey Assad, Sara Groves, Leslie Jordan of All Sons and Daughters, Robbie Seay Band and many others. He has been featured in multiple prominent podcasts and published in CCM Magazine, The Rabbit Room, Relevant Magazine, and The Gospel Coalition. His record, Songs of Common Prayer, an album of congregational worship songs centered around prayers found in the Book of Common Prayer, garnered much attention and was supported by church partnerships across the US. LaFollette has had multiple placements in international advertising campaigns with his band Trouvere, and has contributed many songs to others’ records. His passion to equip the Church is palpable: “I’m always grateful when I hear that a song I have written for myself or my people is useful for someone else. Whether it is sung by a congregation in a church service or given as a gift to a grieving friend, I hope my music feels trustworthy while still telling the truth.” Known for his vulnerable and veracious vocal approach, simple and effective production, and beautiful melodic sense; LaFollette wants his music to be a reminder to the Church that what unites it is greater than what divides it. “May my music be an open door, assuring people that they are wanted and welcome; that there is a place for them.”

campaign.story:
Check out Update #10 for more details...
  Do you love pie?
Do you barely know how to turn your oven on let alone bake a pie?
Do you have a plethora of geeky friends you'd like to completely blow away at your next game night, movie marathon, or other special occasion?
Good! Because I'm here to show you how your first pie, can be the most epic pie your friends have ever seen... with Pie Guides!
                        My name is Jessica (aka @ThePieous) and I think Pies are Awesome.
In my non-pie life I'm a filmmaker, designer and a big geek who loves to learn new things. Last year when I decided to finally learn how my oven works and bake my very first pie, I turned to the web for inspiration. I found thousands of gloriously geeky cakes, waffles, cookies, cupcakes, breads, muffins, rice crispy treats, pancakes... but almost no geeky pies. Seriously! I mean, geeks like pies, right? So what gives?
Well, I did a bit of digging and it turns out, people think making pies is hard. I was told by veteran baker friends that even working with pre-fab rollout crusts is too much of a challenge to "fancy up" because of the speed with which you have to work before the dough starts to dry out and crack.
BUT! If I could think of a way to speed up the process of creating awesome designs in pie dough, suddenly there would be nothing standing in the way of an army of geeky Pie-oneers filling the web with weird and wonderful pie-y goodness...
Enter my "Pie Guides”!
To correct the horrible imbalance of "regular" vs. "geeky" pies out there in the universe, I invented a simple modular system of Pie Guides that allow anyone - from baking novice to pie god - to create sophisticated and fun pie crust designs in under 10 minutes (because really, why should cakes have all the fun?) 
Now I need your help to raise $2000 to place a minimum first order based on my prototypes.
If you, like me, believe it is time for pies to take their rightful place as the kings and queens of geeky desserts we all know they can be, click on that big 'ol green "Back This Project" button and ‘dough your part’ in becoming a true Pie-oneer!
    Sections in the project page:
How to Use Pie Guides
Powder Guide Kits
The Ultimate Pie Guide
Research & Development
Backer Rewards
Stretch Goals
Pies Are Awesome in the Media
Thank you!
With just a $10 (Canadian!) pledge, you can get your oven mitts on one of these bad boys... 
Each individual Pie Guide can create many unique pie designs quickly and easily. It was a tough process to decide which designs would make the cut for the first batch of Pie Guide prototypes, but after a few months of consultation with expert geek focus groups, I narrowed it down to these six and I hope you dig them! 
Pie Guide 1: Rampant Unicorn 
You can't spell "geek" without "unicorn", right? With modular legs and hair, the Rampant Unicorn Pie Guide gives you the freedom to control your level of pie epicness. Plus you can add a bit of food colouring and sprinkles to your dough to really kick things up a notch with some full-on rainbow unicorn pie power! 
Pie Guide 2: Graphic C'thulhu 
What is it about C'thulhu and pies that go so well together? The Graphic C'thulhu Pie Guide offers my own Celtic Knot-esque twist on the Lovecraftian creature of legend, complete with Elder God symbol. Give your Necronomicon book club something to consume while you wait for the denizens of R'yleh to consume you! 
Pie Guide 3: The Murder Kitties 
Yin and Yang, Love and Hate, warm fuzzy hearts and cold steel glocks... The Murder Kitties Pie Guide has it all! You can produce positive or negative designs on one pre-fab pie crust as the guide cutouts are designed to fit within one another to maximize your design options. 
Pie Guide 4: Fire Breathing Dragon 
A classic geeky offering - the Fire Breathing Dragon Pie Guide is perfect for those marathon viewing parties. Game of Thrones night? Hobbit-a-thon? Kicking it old school with a little Dragon Slayer? (I love that movie) Whatever your friends are into, you'll be the hero of the evening when you throw down this fiery offering.   
Pie Guide 5: Moustache Man 
Would you like a little weird with your wonderful? The Moustache Man Pie Guide has got you covered. Emulate your mustachioed friend for his birthday, give a handlebar 'stach a ride on a regular ol' cherry pie, or create an epic abstract masterpiece out of dozen of different lip warmers. The pie-sibilities are endless! 
Pie Guide 6:  Pi Mandala 
One of the most versatile of the bunch, the Pi Mandala Pie Guide allows you to create gorgeously geeky works of art with hundreds of different possible combinations. You can combine these shapes with your own cookie cutters at home for even more options, or keep things classic with a simple Pi symbol cutout to celebrate next Pi Day on March 14th.  
A $10 pledge gets you the Pie Guide of your choice from the six options above. While each of these first six Pie Guides can create multiple compositions on their own, when you combine them together you can really unleash your inner geek with dragon-winged kitties, heavily armed unicorns, and moustache mandalas. So have a look at the higher pledge levels that allow you to get all six at a discount!  
To use any of these Pie Guides - alone or together - simply place the Guides on your chilled dough, use a sharp knife to trace the outlines, and then lift the cutouts with your knife and place as desired.  
Easy peasy!  
I have over a hundred 8" diameter Pie Guides designed on paper already - everything from sea monsters and submarines to rockets and robots to pandas and poodles - and my hope is to be able to continue to offer nifty new designs to the pie-loving public. But first we have to make this campaign a success! 
  If you are ready to help me bring my Pie Guides to the world, please click on the green "Back This Project" button and select a reward level. If you'd like to see some more of Pie Guides in action, read on... 
Geeky Upgrade! Add incredible effects and detail with the “Powder Guide” Kits. 
The basic Pie Guides outlined above are the just the first batch of what will (hopefully!) be many more designs to come... But I wanted to also offer a unique incentive for backers who select the option of purchasing multiple sets of Pie Guides. The following "Powder Guide Kits" are special Guides that incorporate both a traditional Pie Guide for cutting out dough, and a "Powder Guide" - made of a thinner flexible clear foodsafe material - for adding additional, finer detail in your favourite powder such as cinnamon or cocoa. 
These kits allow for more sophisticated compositions without adding any additional complexity to the creation process. If you can sprinkle spices from a jar, you can pull these off! 
To use the Powder Guides in the kits, simply:
create your basic shapes with the regular Pie Guide in the kit
place your Powder Guide on top and give it a quick egg white wash
sprinkle your cinnamon (or powder of your choice) and blow off the excess
lift off the Powder Guide to reveal a unique and beautiful pie design!
To date, I have created and tested prototypes for two different Powder Guide Kits... 
Powder Guide Kit 1: Math Butterflies 
The Math Butterflies Powder Guide Kit consists of four beautiful sets of wings covered in some of my favourite mathematical symbols. At first glance your guests will be greeted with a lovely array of textured butterflies in flight, but on closer inspection the true nerdy nature of this pie will be revealed...  
Powder Guide Kit 2: Steampunk Caravan 
"Carry me caravan, take me away..."  The whimsical Steampunk Caravan Powder Guide Kit just begs to be tricked out with your own special touches... particularly with details from the other Pie Guides (I'm picturing a C'thulhu attack erupting around the wagon from a steaming cherry pie sea. Anyone else picturing that? No, just me?) 
UPDATE Three new Powder Guides just announced: Mr Puggy Face, Eye Brain Eater, and Retro Rockets! You wanted cute, you wanted gross, you wanted Retro... you got it. Choose from any of these, or the two above.
  My final offering in the initial volley of Pie Guides is something I'll wager no one in your circle has ever seen: "The Ultimate Custom Pie Guide" - aka. your face on a pie.  
Picture this:  
presenting your pie-loving brother with his favourite pie, adorned with his smiling face, for a graduation present 
preparing a buffet table filled with dozen of different flavours of wedding pie, each featuring the likeness of the happy couple 
surprising your impossible-to-buy-for spouse with their mug on a pie for their birthday 
proposing to your fiance, in pie form, with a special message and image served as the final course of a home cooked meal 
freaking out your D+D group by constantly bringing a pie with your face on it to every game night and shouting "eat me!" as you deposit your creepy edible centrepiece in the middle of the table 
Okay, maybe I'm the only one who thinks that last one is cool... But whatever you use your "Ultimate Custom Pie Guide" kit for, I guarantee the recipients will never forget it!  
I make each custom kit myself using high contrast, high resolution images which you provide, and creating two illustration components:  
1) A basic Pie Guide, which forms the head outline in pie dough, plus a simple decorative shape if desired 
2) A Powder Guide, which creates all of the fine detail in contrasting powder, and may also include a short line of text 
Together, these custom Pie Guides and Powder Guides combine to create one-of-a-kind images of your friends and loved ones (or any other image you own the rights to) in the immortal medium of pie.  
Okay, its not really very immortal. But it is darn cool. 
  This reward level is limited though, so act fast if you want one!   
The making of each Pie Guide and Powder Guide involves a process of: 
Brainstorm sketching 
Sketch refinement and focus group testing 
Digital mock up in Illustrator 
File refinement for manufacturing 
Material selection and negotiations/QC with manufacturer  
Prototype stress testing 
Prototype pie testing with third parties 
Design refinement as needed (when angles too sharp or detail too fine) 
Final documentation and design lock 
I have gone through this process with all of the designs featured in the above sections, but I need your help to complete the next step! In order to make my Pie Guides available to the world at a reasonable price, I need to place a minimum-sized bulk order with my manufacturer. Which is why I am looking to raise $2000 (Canadian!) from you, the good people of Kickstarter.  
But I don't expect anyone to help me out of the goodness of their hearts... gosh no! So, what's in it for you if you back this project? Read on... 
Whether you're a master baker (tee hee), just a little pie curious, or simply a fan of the whole "pie" thing, there's a reward level for you!  
And if you are looking to order a Pie Guide as a gift for a baker friend this Christmas/Chanukah/Festivus/etc. I've got you covered... The manufacture has told us that the heat from the laser partially seals the protective film to the cutting edges, and because the Butterfly design is so complex, there are way more edges which makes it inevitable that some bits will want to stay stuck on. campaign.story:
Introducing the DotsPlus "Super Grid" Notebook
Hello Kickstarters. I’m excited to introduce you to my new notebook design—DotsPlus.
DotsPlus was inspired by my own dissatisfaction with conventional dot grid notebooks. I like the grid concept, but dots alone make me cross eyed. So, instead of dots, I created a 1/4-inch grid of crosshairs—or plus signs. I found this pattern mush less visually obtrusive than traditional graph paper, while making it much easier for me to write in straight lines and freehand draw tables, charts and graphs.
I then added back the dot grid, and offset the dots so they're positioned at the center of the squares defined by the crosshairs. This helps me center letters, numbers and symbols inside the squares, and makes it easy to add finer details on my tables, charts and graphs.
The 1/4-inch spacing is intentional—it's the traditional "narrow ruled" format for lined paper here in the USA. For me, it economizes on space without being too tight for everyday note taking.
I tried several different colors for the pattern—including traditional "graph paper" blue and "engineering grid" green—and concluded light gray is the most unobtrusive.
The resulting "super grid" of dots and crosshairs is easy on the eyes and remarkably useful for keeping my notes and charts neat and tidy. DotsPlus is great for writing, sketching, designing and doodling—and I think you'll find it especially useful for bullet journaling and do-it-yourself planner layouts.
Just like the PocketDoJo Checklist Notebook in my last campaign, each DotsPlus notebook starts with a Contents/Index page, and ends with an Endnotes page. All of the DotsPlus-imprinted pages in-between are sequentially numbered, with title and date blocks at the top of each page, and my special page navigation arrows at the bottom of each page for tracking projects, lists, plots and thoughts that continue on multiple and non-sequential pages.
I’m offering DotsPlus in two formats—a soft pocket notebook and a larger hardcover notebook (product details below). I'm also offering a free download so you can print a sample page and try before you buy (download link below).
DotsPlus Pocket Notebook Specs
DotsPlus is the latest addition to my Efficiency Supply Co. pocket notebook collection, which includes the PocketDoJo Checklist Notebook, plus new Blank and Lined companion notebooks.
Notebook Size: 3.5" by 5.5"—the most common size among popular pocket notebook brands.
Page Style: DotsPlus pattern, crosshair grid with dot grid overlay, 1/4-inch grid spacing, light gray print on white paper.
Cover: 100# jet black cover stock.
Paper: 60#, bright white, archival-quality, acid-free.
Pages: 52 pages total—50 sequentially numbered pages with DotsPlus pattern, plus Contents/Index first page and Endnotes last page.
Binding: Two black staples.
Sticker Sheet: A special sticker sheet is included, with a title block sticker for the outside front cover, a nameplate sticker for the inside front cover to identify the book as yours in case you misplace it, plus color-coded stickers to differentiate multiple notebooks at a glance.
Origin: Made in USA.
DotsPlus Hardcover Notebook Specs
DotsPlus hardcover books are made in USA by the veteran-owned world-leading manufacturer of engineering, laboratory and field notebooks for Fortune 100 companies, research universities and government agencies. Our books are made to the same exacting standards required for evidence, data and intellectual property protection—so you can be sure they're perfect for preserving your precious ideas, designs, artwork, plots and thoughts. 
Notebook Size: 5.25" x 8.25" x 0.67"—the same size as the popular Moleskine® hardcover notebook.
Page Style: DotsPlus pattern, crosshair grid with dot grid overlay, 1/4-inch grid spacing, light gray print on white paper.
Cover: Black and completely blank—front, back and spine—because it's your book to decorate. PVC-free, water and stain-resistant, sticker and paint-pen friendly.
Paper: 80#, bright white, archival-quality, acid-free.
Page Layout: 168 pages total—166 sequentially numbered pages with DotsPlus pattern, plus Contents/Index first page and Endnotes last page.
Page Marker: One black ribbon.
Binding: Smyth sewn, so the book lays flat when open.
Origin: Made in USA.
Try Before You Buy
Follow this link to download and print a sample page and try it yourself before you pledge. I think you'll be pleasantly surprised.
Rewards
I'm keeping the reward structure super simple, to minimize shipping costs and get your notebooks to you as quickly as possible.
Just Pocket Notebooks: The pocket notebooks are packaged in 3-packs. You can pledge for 1, 2, 4 or 10 three-packs (3, 6, 12 or 30 individual notebooks), and take advantage of quantity discounts.
Just Hardcover Notebooks: The hardcover notebooks are packaged individually. You can pledge for 1, 2, 4 or 10 individual notebooks, and take advantage of quantity discounts.
Notebook Bundles: Double-down on DotsPlus with a combo pack of one 3-pack of pocket notebooks and one individual hardcover notebook. You can pledge for 1, 2, 4 or 10 combo packs, with the same quantity discounts as the other rewards.
Free USA Shipping: All rewards include shipping within the USA.
Delivery Goal
My goal is to ship all rewards by December 15, 2016 (not 2017—that's a typo in the $42 and $78 reward descriptions) so they're in your hands before the New Year, so you can get a fresh start on your new notebook for 2017. Deliveries in the USA and Canada usually arrive within 5-10 days. International deliveries can take 2-4 weeks.
Thank you!
So, if you like dot grid notebooks, I think you’ll LOVE DotsPlus. Thanks for reading, and happy journaling.

campaign.story:
Patent Pending
Sometimes it's about what you don't see. Most of our shoelace pictures are up-close shots portraying a unique design with parallel lines. They actually look really cool and add some character. From eye level though, it's a different story. You would never spot them on someone passing by.
Minimal by design. The Lace Anchors are manufactured from a fiber filled resin providing amazing strength and preventing any breakage or warping. The end clips, if used, have multiple rows of teeth that clinch the laces. This allows you to pull as hard as you would like without the end clips separating from the laces. We did, however, design the end clips to be adjustable, this means you can unlock them and re-lock them if you need to make shoelace length adjustments.
It's about combining style, comfort and convenience. Our Xpand shoe lacing system packs a powerful punch. We want to make sure that we have our bases covered when it comes to all aspects of wearing your shoes. First we offer you 24 colors. Then we offer you a fully adjustable fit providing comfort whether you're heading out for a night on the town or running a marathon. Last but not least, you will never have to tie your shoes again! We know it's not some crazy technology product promising to teleport you to the moon, but we can guarantee it will bring a smile to your face everyday you slip your feet in.  Sometimes it's about the simple things in life.
Zero interruptions, 100% focus. When using our lacing system, your shoes will never cause any distractions like untied laces or tension loss. You will be able to focus 100% on hitting that next mile marker and making it to the finish line. You get to decide how tight or loose your shoes will fit by adjusting pre-set tension when installing the Lace Anchors.  Whether it's in your cross-fit class or on a treadmill, we guarantee there will be zero shoelace malfunctions!
Less bulk more comfort.  Not only does our system rid your shoes of the bulky mechanical objects other systems use, we believe our laces provide more comfort.  Round elastic laces can cause pressure along the top of your feet, whereas our flat laces provide a more even spread-out pressure.
 Kids love to be as creative as you will let them be.  Not only will you love the fact that your kids shoes are magically transformed into perfect fitting slip-ons, but you're giving them the opportunity to show off their creative side!  They can start in any eyelet and finish in any eyelet, creating awesome designs that they can actually wear!
           Reflective laces unlocked!
These are great for any night time activities. They will send off a reflective glow from almost any light source. These will be offered in 5 - 10 of the most popular colors! These images were shot in normal light conditions WITHOUT the camera flash and then in dark conditions WITH the camera flash.
Glow in the dark laces unlocked!
These are our glow in the dark laces. Kids will love these. They are charged by placing them under bright light for 30 seconds. The glow will last approximately 5 minutes.
Rainbow laces unlocked!
Our rainbow laces have a really smooth color transition with a different pattern on each side. The colors included on each lace are as follows: Orange, red, blue, green, yellow, purple and pink.
   We are ready to rock and roll!  Over the past 3 years we have been designing and developing all components of the Xpand lacing system. It started with our very first Kickstarter project, Lace Anchors, which rounded up 9,565 backers and $147,000.  We have successfully tested Lace Anchors with people all around the world.  All of the hard work is done.  The molds and tooling have just been completed and what you see in this campaign are actual production parts.  Our shoelace manufacturer has successfully run hundreds of production cycles with their equipment to ensure their ability to manufacture consistent quality laces for us.  We have turned to Kickstarter to launch Xpand into the world, hoping for thousands of backers so we can place a huge initial purchase order.  Below you will find information that merely skims the surface of our Journey thus far.     
 Seattles Pillar Product Design Team.  Without the Pillar team involved in this project, Xpand would not be what it is today.  They have the creative minds and dedication to make ideas reality.  They are behind some amazing innovative ideas.  It's always a pleasure working with them! 
The "end clips" were designed to give a finished look for those using the Lace Anchors on the exterior of the shoes. Great for marathon runners.
The interior of the end clips are specifically designed for the Xpand shoelaces. The teeth are strategically placed pinching our laces with great tension.
Since we had a solid functioning design from our existing Lace Anchors for standard shoelaces, the changes were minimal for our Xpand laces. "Minimal" is the key word in our designs!
Once the design was finalized for the end clips, 3D prints are sent to the tool makers to complete the production molds.
Same goes for the Lace Anchors. Once the design was finalized, 3D prints were sent to the tooling company to prepare "molds".
After several small adjustments to the teeth size and material used, we have a flawless product! These are pictures of actual samples from the mold!

Finally, finish the day proud of the work you have accomplished!
The Productivity Planner is designed to help you actually get your important tasks done and not just feel busy and overwhelmed. By using the Productivity Planner you will achieve great things in your life and work. Consistently.
We’ve done the hard work of compiling productivity hacks used by successful people throughout history into this simple tool that you can now use to make your own mark in history.
Our mission is to help you be more efficient and productive on a daily basis. By using the Productivity Planner, you will create new habits that will enable you to be more focused and be healthier in the long-term.
 Highlights
End your days feeling accomplished – Say goodbye to the days of merely being busy, but not getting any meaningful work done. The Productivity Planner helps organize your day by keeping you focused on your most important tasks of the day.
Complete a full workday in fewer hours  – With the Productivity Planner, you’ll work in shorter, more focused bursts called Pomodoros that will make sure you are not diluting your energy or worse, wasting your time. Email, social media, and your cell phone will not have anything on you.
Tiny progress = A better you – At the end of each day you will rank how effective you were. Day by day you will learn your productivity patterns. With clear tracking in place, soon you will become one of the most productive people you know.
Share Our Kickstarter Campaign and Get a FREE PDF of the Productivity Planner. We want as many people as possible to become more productive and you can be part of the movement. In order to get your free PDF bundle, click the big button below and share with your friends.
                        Three years ago we created the Five Minute Journal as a simple, effective tool to help the world become happier everyday. We have helped over 50,000 people accomplish that mission. That is a lot of happy people!
Being fans of physical notebooks, we were searching for a simple, elegant daily planner to help us become more productive. We found nothing we liked until we stumbled upon this productivity legend...
Around 100 years ago, PR consultant Ivy Lee shared with Charles Schwab, CEO of Bethlehem Steel, a time management technique that drastically increased his productivity. The method was quite simple. List out your three to five most important tasks for the day and tackle them in order of importance. This simple technique made Schwab millions and helped the unknown Bethlehem Steel Company become the biggest independent steel producer in the world.
This technique and story has been told by many, including Napoleon Hill and Dale Carnegie, and has influenced thousands of people and their businesses.
  We tried Lee's prioritized to-do list for a while to help plan our days, but something was missing. We were still inefficient with our time as there was no rhyme or reason to the list. We could cherry-pick jobs such as “edit blog” or “connect with event manager.” The tasks did not flow. There had to be a better way!
We combined Lee’s method with the Pomodoro-style focused work sessions and a daily productivity score to learn about our work patterns and become more effective. Like the Five Minute Journal, we kept the structure minimalist and clutter free.
*** LEGAL NOTICE *** Pomodoro® and The Pomodoro Technique® are trademarks of Francesco Cirillo. The Productivity Planner and Intelligent Change is not affiliated or associated with or endorsed by Pomodoro™, The Pomodoro Technique™ or Francesco Cirillo. More informations on The Pomodoro Technique® can be found on www.pomodorotechnique.com
While a heap of planners exist on the market, we believe the Productivity Planner is the simplest, most effective tool for getting meaningful work done. Consistently. Everyday.
 Five Most Important Tasks of the Week: If these were the only tasks you completed during the week, you would be satisfied. 
Tasks of Secondary Importance: Tasks to be completed only after the Most Important Tasks of the Week 
Additional Tasks 
Commitment: One action to make the week more productive. 
What's does a productive day consist of?
1. Quote of the Day - To inspire you to seize the day.
2. Most Important Task of the Day (MIT) - The heartbeat of the Productivity Planner. You will focus on accomplishing your long term big wins, not merely keeping busy.
3. Pomodoro Time Tracking - This is where the magic happens. Distractions will soon be a thing of the past as you learn to manage your time efficiently using short Pomodoro single task work sessions.
4. Important Tasks apart from the Most Important Task of the Day
5. Space for Notes - Ideas, future tasks, inspiration, etc.
6. Productivity Score - A daily productivity score to learn about your work patterns and become more effective over time.
Weekly Wins: Accomplishments of the week you are proud of. 
What tasks were not completed last week?: Recommitment to these tasks for the upcoming week.
What have you learned this week?: Weekly reflection to learn about your work patterns and become more effective.
Next Week: Actions you will take to make the upcoming week productive.

PLAY

Stretch Goals Achieved
 How it All Started
In November 2013, we launched the first EcoQube on Kickstarter and raised over 200% our campaign goal, turning our idea into a reality.
Following a long and tedious manufacturing and production process, our first shipment of EcoQubes finally arrived in October 2014.
Our manufacturing and prototype partners in the US  
 Check out the finished product below!
PLAY

                                                                      We shipped the EcoQubes out to all our backers and received an overwhelmingly positive response. 
We couldn't have asked for a more amazing, supportive community of backers! Check out the forum they created showcasing their EcoQubes here! 
We wanted to make the EcoQube even more accessible and efficient, so we took all the feedback we got to further develop the product, which resulted in the EcoQube C!
 What is the EcoQube C?
The heart of the EcoQube C is the aquaponics filter, which we've integrated into the tank to create an all-in-one system that uses plants like Basil or Mint to keep your aquarium clean.
PLAY

How does it work?
PLAY

Simply decorate your tank and fill it with water, plug it in and enjoy your very own sustainable ecosystem!
Why is it better?
The new beautifully integrated design is durable, portable, and compact. We've made it more affordable while maintaining the high quality product build. It's now even easier to maintain with less parts and automatic functionality, AND it's manufactured in the USA.
Never change or replace filters again with the EcoQube! Everything Works. Together.
 Our Story
PLAY

Our names are Eric and Kevin. We're UC San Diego students and aquarium geeks who met in high school and share a passion for planted aquatic ecosystems. 
We started out working at various aquarium shops in San Francisco, including Aquatic Central and Aqua Forest Aquarium. We eventually started our own online aquarium store called Aqua Design Innovations while selling shrimp out of a garage.
As we got older, we started to become more aware of the harsher realities of our world, realizing that there are many people globally who face food and water shortages every day but that for most of us, such issues are so foreign.
We couldn't ignore the facts, so we decided to use our knowledge of aquariums to find a feasible solution.
We believe aquaponics is a clear solution to many of the food and water shortages humanity faces today. While this food production method was used thousands of years ago in early Aztec and Chinese civilizations, it has since fallen into disuse and become largely forgotten.
We hope to educate as many people as possible about the practical solution and beauty of aquaponics and to ultimately help initiate the process of bringing aquaponics to the forefront of today's agriculture. 
We were able to reach many with the first EcoQube, and now, we hope to reach even more with the EcoQube C! Please join our mission and share the EcoQube C with as many people you know!
Original EcoQube (left) and EcoQube C (right)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've spent most of the last year working with our partners to mitigate as many risks as possible, yet we know there will still be hurdles along the way. We will always be transparent with our community about challenges, including these:

The biggest risk is having users eat the herbs they've grown in their EcoQube C. This is because professional aquaponics farms do not use regular aquarium chemicals for their water treatments. It is entirely unknown if chemicals from regular water treatments will find their way into the herbs. Also, aquariums with frogs, turtles, snails and other more disease-prone animals should not be eaten from. There are simply too many unknowns, and nobody wants a case of salmonella poisoning! It is not recommended to eat anything you produce through the EcoQube C.

Ship Date: We are confident we will ship by the projected dates, as we are manufacturing the EcoQube C in the US (100 yards away from our office!). While there is always a chance that things will take longer than planned, the proximity of our manufacturers will definitely speed up the process!

Product Changes: As we refine the EcoQube C based on additional community feedback and more product testing, slight changes may be made. We'll only make changes that enhance the product experience. 

Supplier Coordination: We work with a variety of suppliers to source the best materials and ensure that the product is developed correctly. Each supplier has its own challenges, which may affect its partners, including us.

Maintenance: As hard as we've worked to make this AS LOW MAINTENANCE AS POSSIBLE, it is still a living ecosystem. As with all ecosystems, imbalances can be prompted if your kids throw in a bag of fish food thinking the fish will grow faster, or if the aquarium is placed in the sun even though it comes with a beautiful bright light. Imbalances will cause algae growth and will require a tiny bit of wiping.

DISCLAIMER

Herbs and micro-greens can be extremely great filters and will thrive with the EcoQube C, but for that same reason, it is EXTREMELY unsafe for food consumption. Chemicals used for aquariums are NOT safe for human consumption and the plants WILL soak these chemicals up. Consumption of the plants grown in the EcoQube C is NOT recommended for humans.

Hey Kickstarter! We're organizing the Offline Conference (@offlineconf), a gathering of creative people in Baltimore, Maryland this June 4th–5th.
The internet is filled with hard working, nice people, and if you’re reading this chances are you’re one of them. And thanks to services like Dribbble, Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter, we’re more connected to one another than we’ve ever been. And yet, there’s a distance, as well. Online, we’re all alone together.
The Offline Conference is about closing that distance. It’s about connecting with one another face to face — about listening to each other's stories, learning from one another, and building lasting friendships. 
At Offline, there are no speakers or attendees: there are only participants. The event is centered on small group discussions, where each participant shares their unique experiences and perspective with the others. campaign.story:
Seahorse Pillowpet
The women of the Pacutama and Chuicutama Cooperative in Santa Catarina Village
Just shy of 8,000 feet above sea level, Santa Catarina Village is in one of Guatemala's most beautiful but least hospitable environments. 
Pacutama and Chuicutama were two coastal communities resettled to the mountains after Hurricane Stan destroyed their homes in 2005.
Cotton is woven with the backstrap loom.
Weaving in Action
1. Members of the cooperative weave natural cotton into traditional Mayan cloth with the backstrap loom.
2. The cotton then goes to the city where community women sew the fabric into pillowpets.
 When you buy a pillowpet, you get a cute and cuddly creature with a connection to another culture. The Pacutama and Chuicutama Women's Cooperative receives direct income through your purchase.
Due to the extreme remote location of the work and the intrinsic nature of backstrap loom weaving, it only makes sense for the cooperative to sell in "bulk." By buying between 50 and 100 seahorses, we provide a meaningful income boost to the community without infusing a malignant quantity of cash into the village economy. A Kickstarter campaign is the most direct way to reach customers while ensuring that as much of the money as possible goes directly to the women creating the pillowpets.  
$22 for a seahorse. 
Be one of the first 40 backers, and get yours right away. 
Check out all the perks here.
 After agriculture, artisan goods are the second largest source of employment in the developing world. By backing this campaign, you are buying a one-of-a-kind pillowpet, empowering female breadwinners in an indigenous, Guatemalan community.
  In a small village called Santa Catarina Ixhtahuacan in the mountains east of Quetzaltenango, 20 women whose village was resettled here after the devastation of Hurricane Stan in 2005, work together to weave traditional Mayan textiles using the backstrap loom (see below for more information on backstrap loom weaving).
The village was re-settled (see video footage above) in large part thanks to Yabal, an NGO brought into the region to help the indigenous K'iche' group cope with the dramatic environmental, economic and social changes that resulted from their evacuation. Yabal helped evacuate and resettle two coastal villages (Pacutama and Chuictama) into one mountain community called Santa Catarina Ixhtahuacan. The land was available here for a homesteaded resettlement because the surrounding environment (in terms of climate and accessibility) is quite remote and intemperate -- making it undesirable but vacant.
Temperatures in Santa Catarina Ixhtahuacan can go from the high 20s to the high 90s Fahrenheit in a single 24-hour day. As a result, community members have had to adapt much of their lifestyle and agricultural economy to survive. Because the growing season is so short, and because the village is cut-off from traditional regional commerce, everyone has had to innovate.
Forming the Pacutama and Chuicutama Cooperative (named after their former villages) in the wake of post Hurricane Stan resettlement was a way for the female members of the new, hybrid community to once again take control of their own fate. To support the effort, Yabal formed a handicrafts support entity and laid the foundations for the cooperative’s success with handicrafts and business trainings as part of a market readiness program. Soon, the women had the business and tangible skills to work together to create beautiful textiles just like their ancestors had done for centuries. Now the trick was in finding the market in which to sell.
To solve the sales problem, Yabal partnered the Pacutama and Chuicutama Cooperative with designers and a local seamstress named Sylvia Mazariegos. As a collaborative trifecta, the parties created the pillowpet design and setup a network of talented sewing women in Quetzaltenango (the nearest large city). As a result, the pillowpets project has been able to create valuable, fair wage yielding trades for both rural and urban women who each bring a sense of empowerment (along with the extra money) to their families in both the city and the mountains.
Perhaps no cultural handicraft is as synonymous with the Central American region as backstrap loom weaving. The loom gets its name from the leather strap that weavers wear around their waists to keep tension in the threads and the cloth, and so the distinctive Mayan cloth is quite literally attached to its creator while it’s being made. Check out the video above to see the backstrap loom in action.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are many challenges that go along with sourcing handicrafts directly from artisans around the world. Aside from the obvious (language skills, cultural-savvy, affordable international payment methods and access to the internet), we’ve dealt with our fair share of customs challenges, quality control issues and disparity of customer/artisan expectations. We’ve been working on perfecting our model for the past 2.5 years. We started in Mexico, Russia and Kyrgyzstan where we began to introduce artisans to the somewhat foreign concept of online selling, and began actively making ecommerce sales and fulfilling the orders directly in cooperation with our partnering artisans. 

By now, we’ve ironed out the kinks in the “supply chain.” We have reliable partnering organizations and artisans such as Yabal Handicrafts and the women of Santa Catarina Ixhtahuacan village who buy into our mission and share our dream. Now it’s time to move onto the next level, and setup a test crowdfunding sale, which is what you’re looking at right here. 

We chose pillowpets to be our first test sale because of their broad appeal, high quality, ethical backstory, light weight (for shipping) and general awesomeness (we just love them!). 

The completed pillowpets will be sent fast via TNT bulk from Guatemala to our office in San Francisco, where we’ll immediately parse-out the pet supply and send them on their way to you via the US mail. We have pre-ordered the first 40 seahorse pillowpets so the first 40 seahorse backers will be able to enjoy their pillowpet ASAP; the rest will have to wait for a second round of weaving, and will likely get theirs sometime in February. 

After over two years of first hand experience and work on this project (I’ve personally lived and worked in Kyrgyzstan), I can honestly say we’re ready for this next step: a crowd-funded artisan campaign. What we need is your support to prove that our dream can become a reality. 

Thanks so much. 
Pete
--
Pete Rognli
Sysremic Idealist
GlobeIn, http://globein.com/
