campaign.story:
It's Time To Put Love Back Into Living!
Ever notice how easy it is to go through life with your head down?  Not noticing all the great things around you because you're too busy surviving to really live?
That's what "Love Where You Live" is setting out to change.  My dream is to use this video travelogue (aka "travel blog") to inspire you to love where you live, wherever that may be.  To stop, look around, and enjoy the place you call home.
It will start here in my home state of Idaho.  I LOVE it here.  So much so that I've turned down opportunities to move away several times because I love it so much.  So, telling the stories of people and places that make this place great excites me.
But it's not going to stop there.
See, I believe there are places the world over where folks can say "I Love Where I Live!" My hope is to celebrate those places too.  The people, the history, the beauty, the heartache, and everything in-between.  Those unique things that make a place more than just a dot on a map, but a place people are proud to call home.
What Will It Be Like?
This will be far more than a documentary.  Instead, it will be produced so you will feel like you are right there - exploring, learning, feeling and being right along with me.  
We will explore the sights, scenery, stories, and people that make that place amazing, and inspire you to love where you live, wherever that may be.
Love Where You Live will be more than some stale documentary, it will be an adventure you will EXPERIENCE, not just watch.
The first Love Where You Live travelogue will be approximately 10-15 minutes in length and be made available online through social media, the website and on YouTube.  There is also a developing relationship that would feature segments of the travelogue on local television.  Read on for more on that!
A Bright Future.
This first travelogue will be an example of what future travelogues to come will look and feel like.  This first travelogue adventure will be the spark that 'Kickstarts" many others!  The plan moving forward is to produce a minimum of eight 10-15 minute episodes by the end of 2015.
Already on our way - I am already seen on the local CBS affiliate - KBOI, Channel 2 doing movie reviews (Reviews For The Rest Of Us) and they have expressed interest in incorporating segments from the "Love Where You Live" travelogue into their early news!  We just have to get the ball rolling and get one produced!
Where Does My Money Go?
Almost all of the equipment used to create the Kickstarter video you see here is loaned.  Meaning, if the owner of that gear needs it for another use, moves, or otherwise decides to no longer loan the gear, well, "dead in the water" comes to mind.
Therefore, this is a startup campaign.  Meaning that, included in the goal is funding not only to travel and film the first travelogue itself, but to purchase the needed gear and studio equipment to create professional, polished products, and ensure the ability to film and create future travelogues, reviews and more for years to come!
These items include:
HD Video camera, lighting and related equipment
Microphones, recording equipment and related accessories
iMac computer for audio and video editing
Travel and related expenses incurred during the recording of first travelogue.
Related production expenses.  I.E paying videographer and other crew, post-production assistance, sound & video element licensing, etc.
Related marketing and business expenses such as Facebook advertising campaign, print campaign and print and other media for presentation to potential future supporting sponsors.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with any project, there will likely be challenges. Weather this time of year could present a hurdle, and scheduling the necessary pieces, destinations and potential interviews may take some time. I am confident neither of those will present any significant issue.

The other hurdle is in creating future travelogues. This is a startup campaign and will provide the monies for all the necessary equipment and supplies to professionally execute the first travelogue. Future travelogues will obviously incur their own expenses. We will present this first travelogue as proof of concept to local businesses and agencies to sell them corporate presenting sponsorship packages to support future travelogues.

campaign.story:
We did it! We finally made a time machine…. Well, more like a TIM3 MACHIN3™. What it lacks in ability to travel through time, it makes up for in saving time for you and your family. 
   CNET TOOK THE TIM3 MACHIN3 FOR A TEST DRIVE.  HOW'D IT DO? 
It makes up to 20 cups of rice. It makes it faster. And it makes it better. 
And it also does much more. 
Yogurt. Quinoa. Oatmeal. Slow Cooking. Steaming. 
We’re hoping you can help us make it a reality. 
How does it work?  
Any backer is eligible for the accessories pack. Just add on $15 to your pledge and we'll make sure to send you the accessory pack as soon as it is available. Please note that it will ship separately from your TIM3 MACHIN3 as the accessory pack will not be completed until MARCH 2015.
With your help, we hit our $100K stretch goal on the last day of our project! Thanks! We'll be commissioning a professional chef to write a digital recipe guide calibrated specifically to the TIM3 MACHIN3! Ships digitally to ALL reward levels in April 2015. If you have a personal relationship with someone you think would be a fit, please message us or email to support@get3squares.com.
Obviously a rice cooker should make rice. They all do. But there are some problems with the rice cookers that are out there (at least the ones that cost less than a car payment). 
Rice takes too long to cook, especially brown rice. What’s the point of automating the cooking if you've got to sit around and wait 2 hours for your rice to finish? We souped up the TIM3 MACHIN3 with 900 watts of power to help get rid of this problem. The result? Our white rice cooks up to 30% faster than competing rice cookers. And brown rice is up to a whopping 45% faster. 
Cooking times in comparison to other 20-cup rice cookers tested.
Another problem: rice burns on the bottom. You cook a couple cups of rice, only to be dismayed by the fact that there's a yellowy-brown skin of rice lining the bottom of the pot when you stir it up to serve. Dry yellow chunks in your rice don’t do anyone any good. So we configured our TIM3 MACHIN3 to solve this issue. With each batch of rice cooked in the TIM3 MACHIN3 you’ll see the rice at the bottom is still nicely cooked, not scorched earth. 
Quinoa is, well, super. NASA has called it almost a perfect food thanks to the amount of protein and nutrition packed in it. Cooking it at home can often end in either a gloopy gruel or what tastes like a big bowl of sand. Since quinoa is a grain (well technically a seed, but it cooks a lot like a grain), a rice cooker should be a perfect way to cook it. But using the same methodology as rice just doesn't pan out. So after a ton of trials, we found that tweaking the cooking logic ever so slightly and including a “toasting” stage prior to cooking really unlocks the flavor potential of this nutritional powerhouse. 
PLAY

Sure, there’s are a ton of yogurt makers out there already. What they don't tell you is that before those yogurt makers do anything, you’ve got to get milk in a double boiler, heat it, measure the temperature, hold it there, pull it off the burner, let it cool to just the right temperature, then finally add the starter and put it in the yogurt “maker.” That’s so much work it made a run-on sentence long enough to make any English teacher shake their head in disgust. 
The TIM3 MACHIN3 makes yogurt making something that's actually easy to do at home. It uses its brain to do all this for you. It heats the milk. Then holds it at the right temperature. It lets the milk cool. It tells you when it’s time to add the starter. Then it makes the yogurt for as long as you set it. 
PLAY

Rice cookers again provide a perfect method for making this, but have never quite gotten it right, particularly with steel cut oatmeal. Leaving it to cook in the rice cooker with the lid closed can lead to you coming back to a Mt. Vesuvius-like explosion of starch all over the cooker and your counter. 
We got tired of having to deal with that and so did our counter tops. So we developed a specialized Oatmeal function for the TIM3 MACHIN3 to cook any type of oatmeal perfectly without any starch-canic eruptions. 
Plus, with the TIM3 MACHIN3’s delay timer you can add your oatmeal and water the night before and wake up to a hot and ready breakfast.
Slow cooking has been such a popular cooking method for so long for a reason. Not only do you get incredible flavor, it’s really, really easy too. A rice cooker and a slow cooker really aren’t that different: both have a heating element under a pot. So we made the TIM3 MACHIN3 a slow cooker too.
Set the TIM3 MACHIN3 to 4, 6 or 8 hours and it will cook your food at a low temperature, slowly increasing as the cooking time comes to a close. So you'll end up with that fall-off-the-bone-flavor everyone loves. It’s just like a digital 4-quart slow cooker, if only a digital slow cooker could do all these other awesome things. 
The TIM3 MACHIN3 also has a programmable steaming option so you can tell it how long to steam your food. It won’t start counting down until the water comes to a boil, so you’re programming exactly how long your food will steam. And you don’t need to keep one eye on the kitchen while it cooks. It’ll automatically switch over to warm once your set time has passed. With a steam tray that hangs above the pot, it’s also a great way to make a complete meal all in the TIM3 MACHIN3. Add your protein and vegetables to the steam tray and have them steam above while rice or quinoa cooks below! 
The key to the TIM3 MACHIN3’s success is our Fuzzy Logic 2.0™ system. 
We developed a smarter brain for our TIM3 MACHIN3 that’s able to handle this heavy cooking load. Our powerful 900-watt heating element (compared to the 650-watt average for rice cookers), allows us to cook faster and make quicker temperature adjustments while cooking. 
A sensor both above and below the cooking pot works in conjuncture with our big rice cooker brain to ensure your food cooks perfectly every time. 
And lastly, we made our cooking pot 20% thicker than the industry standard to prevent the browning that’s so prevalent in rice cookers. We also coated it with a long-life, PFOA-free nonstick coating from Whitford to enhance nonstick release and durability. 
We’re really close to making the TIM3 MACHIN3 a reality. After multiple trips to Asia, we finally identified the right manufacturing partner. We’ve completed our prototypes, received our US electrical safety standard approval (thanks Intertek!) and even finished a pilot run of 50 units. There are a few tooling modifications we need to make in order to get the level of quality we want to achieve. We’re hoping the Kickstarter community can help us achieve our dream. 
Once we reach our modest goal of $10,000, we’ll be able to move forward with production and have TIM3 MACHIN3’s in stock and ready to ship prior to Christmas 2014. Your support is highly appreciated. Thank you!

campaign.story:
*****************************************************************************************************************
Tuesday, Dec 2 @ 10AM: Stretch Goal Achieved!
We'll be able to include an extra special parcel along with the final letter of the story. The parcel will contain none other than the actual "unidentified sculptural object" from A Curious Bit of Matter.
Will you guess what it is before it arrives?
*****************************************************************************************************************
Keep Me Posted: A New Kind of Children's Book
Keep Me Posted is an experimental new format for children's book publishing. Adventurous adults with a keen sense of humor will love it too! We propose to combine the magic of a great original story with the wonder and surprise of receiving letters in the mail. Very tiny letters, actually.
Each whimsical story is told through weekly surprises that arrive via mail.
Put your tablet away and turn off the phone. There's no app or ebook option here. Just pure tangible delight! Pay close attention—and watch your mailbox each week—as these kid's books for all ages unfold.
Technically speaking, this is epistolary fiction. You'll enjoy the story by essentially reading "over the shoulders" of the characters as they write letters back and forth to each other.
Open each tiny letter carefully upon arrival and use the included magnifying glass to keep up with your new favorite characters. A Keep Me Posted story by mail is an innovative gift for kids and adults that love surprises.
Each Keep Me Posted story will be tiny-themed featuring characters like insects, specks of dust, paper clips, teeth, raindrops, zeros and ones, nano-circuits, etc.. It will be equal parts ridiculous, charming, and incredible.
How Does It Work?
Week 1: The first installment of the story arrives via a tiny letter in your mailbox along with a high-quality magnifying glass, character roster, and a small custom box that sets the stage for the story. Use the box for safekeeping of the additional letters that arrive in subsequent weeks.
The first package kicks off the story and will arrive before Christmas!
Weeks 2 Through 6: A new letter will arrive via mail once a week. Each letter will move the story along, via direct communications between characters. Sometimes there might be extras included, like a postcard from a character who's on vacation or some other piece of paper ephemera that plays into the story.
One delightfully original letter arrives each week, plus some fun extras!
Weeks 7 Through Infinity: Take all six letters that make up the story out of the box and read the series over and over, just like you would your favorite traditional children's book.
Are the Letters Truly Tiny?
Yep, they measure 1 x 1.5 inches. You'll most certainly need the magnifying glass, which makes the experience all the more fun and intriguing!
How Will Each Letter Arrive?
The first letter plus the box, character roster, magnifying glass, and a small card (with your name on it as the giver) will arrive in a padded mailer addressed directly to your recipient. Subsequent installments of the story will arrive via regular mail in special translucent envelopes that showcase the tiny wonder inside.
Who wouldn't love finding this in their mailbox?

Story #1: A Curious Bit of Matter
“Check it out. There's a snail in the mailbox! And her name is Shelly. Oh, and look, there's Anton and Buzz too. I bet Alfred the Aphid is hiding in the back underneath all that junk mail.”
To kick off this new concept in publishing, we're seeking your backing for our first story by mail, entitled A Curious Bit of Matter. Installment #1 will arrive before December 25. Wrap it up and put it under the tree! Or have us send your reward as a gift directly to your recipient.
The rest of the story will arrive one letter per week through early February, 2015. If successful, we hope to launch many more wonderful stories by mail in the months and years to come. Help us deliver anticipation and delight to mailboxes around the world by backing this very first tale.
What's A Curious Bit of Matter About?
This first story is about a sweet and clever group of backyard insects that discover a USO (unidentified sculptural object) and try to sort out what to make of it. Along the way, they learn to appreciate the little things in life and the diversity of the natural world.
Can I See a Sample Letter?
Okay, but just the first one. After all, each letter is supposed to be a surprise!
Get your magnifying glass ready!
Who's It For?
The content and characters are appropriate for curious kids of all ages. We've worked in a few inside jokes and obscure references to keep parents entertained too. After all, the best children's stories are the ones that kids and adults can read and appreciate together, over and over again.
We believe that kids are capable of much more than is typically expected. Each child has an inherent ability to discover the world at his or her own pace, one small step at a time. You won't find a strong moral or message at the heart of our stories. Instead, you'll find characters that notice and comment on small details and are mindful and aware of what is happening around them. They'll ask questions, consider various possibilities, and then venture off in search of answers. And it will all be original and vastly entertaining!
Is It Illustrated?
Yes, sort of! The custom box will feature illustrations by Lea, as will the character roster and some of the extras. What's most special about this story is that it's told exclusively via letters sent back and forth among the characters. The focus on written words lets kids exercise their limitless imaginations. Given how much time many kids now spend on iPads or watching television, we think this is a very important detail.
Just enough illustrations to set the scene...
Will My Kid Love It?
Absolutely. Your child (or other recipient) will probably remember the tiny story he or she received via mail forever.

Who Is Lea Redmond?
Lea Redmond is an author and artist. She created the World's Smallest Post Service back in 2008, which surprises and delights thousands of people every year. Lea has tons of experience designing at small scale and loves working with kids.
Lea is also the creator of a successful series of letter writing diaries from Chronicle Books, which includes Letters To My Future Self and Letters To My Baby. She is currently working on four other book projects for various publishers, including a children's picture book.
Who Are Some of Lea's Favorite Children's Book Authors?
David Weisner (Sector 7, Tuesday)
Peter Sis (The Tree of Life, Starry Messenger)
Crockett Johnson (Harold and the Purple Crayon)
Amy Krouse Rosenthal (Spoon, The OK Book)
Lea's mom, Ginger Howard (William's House, Basket of Bangles)

What Is The Current Status?
Design the tiny letters, including miniature stamps, etc. [Done]
Research and select best mailing materials [Done]
Design and illustrate the custom box [In progress]
Write the story [First draft done]
Copyedit the story [Not yet started]
Source awesome magnifying glass [Done]
Package and send first installment to your lucky recipient [By Dec 15]
Will The First Installment Really Arrive by Christmas?
Yes, we're totally committed to making sure your recipient can unwrap the first installment of the story by Christmas morning. Kids don't dig IOUs. They want the real thing in their hands. If you'd like, we can stamp "Open on Xmas" on the outside of the mailer. We'll also include a small card with your name as the person who sent the gift. The rest of the story will unfold in your recipient's mailbox over the next five weeks.

How Will Kickstarter Funds Be Used?
Printing of tiny letters, gift cards, etc.
Cutting die to make custom boxes
Source high-quality magnifying glasses
Hand assembly of tiny letters and extras
Packaging and addressing
Postage and mailing materials
Development of additional stories for future releases

What Happens After Six Weeks?
If all goes well, and with your support, we hope to launch many more Keep Me Posted stories with the same unique epistolary format. Someday, we'd even love to invite other children's book authors to contribute content for future editions.
Help us make opening the mailbox fun again for years to come!

What Is Leafcutter Designs?
Leafcutter Designs is a creative studio run by Lea and her brother Devin in Berkeley, CA. We develop, make, and sell a line of creative gift items via our online shop and we also work with other businesses to produce memorable custom goods for special events. We've launched other creative projects via successful Kickstarter campaigns including Seed Money and Trade Tokens. This is our first effort to self-publish a children's story.

campaign.story:
What is Bullet Journal?
The Bullet Journal is commonly referred to as an analog lifelogging system, but it’s true strength lies in its ability to become anything that you need it to be. It’s the result of more than two decades of experimentation with productivity methods due to learning disabilities; over time, these disabilities wore off, but the effectiveness of the organizational methods endured. By incorporating digital principles into an actual, hand-held notebook, the Bullet Journal offers the flexibility of a blank page with the clarity and structure of a digital system.
Bulletjournal.com was launched just over a year ago to make this system freely available to all. It’s since been featured on Lifehack.org, Lifehacker.com, and Fast Company. The original tutorial video (above) has been viewed over half a million times, and unique communities have sprung up all over the Internet, communities that create and share their own mods and methods. When it comes to being more productive, the Bullet Journal has already proven itself to be an invaluable tool for many.
Why the Kickstarter?
From organizing to-do lists, managing schedules and meetings, tracking health and fitness goals, and everything in between, the Bullet Journal has the amazing ability to organize a very diverse range of data. “Bulletjournalists” are creating new and incredibly valuable tools for tackling everyday organizational challenges. These ideas could be helping significantly more people, but instead they’re getting lost online.
This Kickstarter campaign will fund development of the next version of bulletjournal.com: a stronger, smarter, more intuitive platform that will make it easy for users to find and contribute new methods to make the Bullet Journal system even more useful and effective. The new site will serve as a free library for the ever-growing catalog of productivity methods. The revamped site will also feature fresh tutorials, videos, reviews, resources, and so much more!
What You Get For Pledging

Enjoy early access to new tutorial videos, methods, and project updates
Receive a downloadable PDF of the Key for the new Magic Bullet markup system
Receive a downloadable PDF of the Bullet Journal Guide
Help choose updated features for the new bulletjournal.com
Pledges for $25+
Backers who pledge $25 or more will receive a custom-made, Bullet Journal Notebook made by Leuchtturm1917, one of the finest notebook manufacturers in the market today. This is the only notebook designed from the ground up to be used for Bullet Journaling.
Additional Details:
Stickers for labeling and archiving
Dimensions: 145 x 210 mm
Ink-proof paper (80 g/sq m)
How Kickstarter works
(The following is taken from Kickstarter's info page.)
Kickstarter is a funding platform for creative projects. Everything from films, games, and music to art, design, and technology. Kickstarter is full of ambitious, innovative, and imaginative projects that are brought to life through the direct support of others.
Thousands of creative projects are funding on Kickstarter at any given moment. Each project is independently created and crafted by the person behind it. The filmmakers, musicians, artists, and designers you see on Kickstarter have complete control and responsibility over their projects. They spend weeks building their project pages, shooting their videos, and brainstorming what rewards to offer backers. When they're ready, creators launch their project and share it with their community.
Every project creator sets their project's funding goal and deadline. If people like the project, they can pledge money to make it happen. If the project succeeds in reaching its funding goal, all backers' credit cards are charged when time expires. If the project falls short, no one is charged. Funding on Kickstarter is all-or-nothing.
Backing a project is more than just giving someone money, it's supporting their dream to create something that they want to see exist in the world.

updates.update_userinfo: iPhone 6 Plus Felt Case Production Almost Complete
updates.update_content:
I'm wrapping up a week at our factories and wanted to give our last production-related update. The tooling for the iPhone 6 Plus Felt Case completed last week and they are running all the parts now. The cases look great and function perfectly. All the parts for the "body" of the case are complete and they are putting the felt on today and tomorrow. That means all shipping to you should be done by Monday or Tuesday of next week.
I thought you may want to see some photos of how the Felt Case goes together. You'll notice some of the tooling parts. Two giant pieces of steel hold the smaller steel molds that are pushed together with thousands of pounds of pressure, then the hot plastic is pumped inside, it cools instantly, and then the pieces are pulled apart, and the part is released. It is a pretty impressive process. I've also attached a photo of something pretty unique to the Felt Case. It is the hot press that is pressed down on the felt to activate the heat activated adhesive. Once it is heated, it is virtually impossible to separate the felt from the TPU portion of the case.

If you ordered a Felt Case for the iPhone 6, you should have received your tracking number by now. If you ordered a 6 Plus, you are about one week behind. In either case, you'll be receiving your Felt Case soon. We just wanted to give you a quick update on the care and break-in procedure for your Felt Case. In some ways, the Felt Case is similar to new carpet. When you vacuum new carpet, it tends to have fibers come up for the first few days. The Felt Case acts similarly. 
For the first few days, the loose fibers will wear off and they will usually turn into little balls that don't look particularly good. This is totally normal. Just pull them off for a few days and then you'll never need to do it again. Once the loose fibers are removed, the Felt Case looks and feels great.

campaign.story:
Most of us have been there at some point. Sitting in a meeting, or on hold with the cable company, or listening to a conference call that has gone on past the point of being productive. As the brain starts to wander, the hands reach for a stack of yellow sticky notes. What a fantastic format! Small, square, disposable, and with a sticky strip on the back. In mere moments, a silly drawing or message appears, and can be immediately displayed on the wall, inside a book, on the edge of the computer monitor, or on the back of a friend's jacket as he sneaks by.
If you saw my first two Kickstarter projects, you already know I'm a teacher, as well as an artist. I'm one of those people who needs to keep his hands busy in order to stay focused, so I take a pack of Post-it® Notes with me every time I attend a meeting at the school. I've probably drawn hundreds of sticky note cartoons. Ducks, robots, giraffes, appliances, starfish, stereos, fire hydrants, and a few people. So I've already got an ongoing love affair with the ubiquitous yellow square.
Why?
As the new school year begins, I need a project to work on. It will be used to demonstrate to my students some very important aspects of art. I can show them commitment to a large-scale project that spans months of work. They will see me working daily, and understand the importance of regular, frequent, and rigorous practice. The students will (hopefully) see the effect of that practice, in the form of improved quality or evolving style. I will show them how an artist can make a living through hard work, determination, and commitment, and watch the project go from conception to completion, all over the course of one school year. I can also use examples from this project in lessons on composition, portrait drawing, pencil shading, crosshatching, etc.
So, in the interest of improving art education, inspiring young artists, pushing myself to practice, and bringing hand-made art to the masses... I've decided to begin a huge undertaking. I will draw hundreds of portraits on Post-it® Notes and compile them into one book. The final page count will depend on how many backers send me photos, but ideally, they would number in the hundreds.
PORTRAITS
Each portrait will be hand-drawn (by me) on a 3” x 3” Super Sticky Post-It® Note of my choosing. I like to use pencil, ink, marker, color pencil, chalk, and paint. But not all on the same drawing. Your portrait will be drawn using whichever materials I feel are most appropriate for the image. You can see from the drawings I've already completed, there is a range of media and style. Unfortunately, I am not able to take requests for materials or colors. Sorry!
BOOK
The book will be a collection of hand-drawn portraits (originally on sticky notes), in varying styles and color. While I would like to make the book 3” square, just like the drawings, I think the printing process will require a small border around the images. So I am left with two options: Make the book more like 3.25” square, or lose part of every drawing to edge bleed and trimming. I'm looking at going with the former. So hopefully the book will be 3.35” square, with full color gloss pages. The drawings will be as close to actual size as possible, and one portrait will be on each page. Since the book is so small, I will have to use a special binding method that will allow the pages to open fully.  Normal binding might prevent the book from opening flat, and we would not be able to see the part of the drawing closest to the spine.  I want to be able to see the entire image on every page...  So we are left with a very expensive method for binding.  The more backers buy a portrait, the more pages will go in the book. I'd like to have more than 250 images, but 200 will be the minimum.
I'll be working with the same local printing company that produced The Heartless Machine Guide To Drawing, and 99 Ways to Die: a Coloring Book for Adults.  They make fantastic books, right here in Austin TX, and they consistently provide me with the service and quality I need.  I DO NOT have books made in China.  My products are always made in the USA.
The binding is very important to me.  I always strive for quality.  So with this book, it came down to two options.  There's a cheap way to do it, and a quality way to do it.  Look at the difference:
On the left, you will see a cheaply bound book, meant for mass-distribution. Notice how the spine is fully glued, and the damage sustained when opening the book.  See how the spine of the book is already falling apart, and I haven't even read the book!  This will not do.  When I am done reading it, I will put the book on the shelf, and the ugly spine creases will be all I see!
On the right, there is an extra step to binding this book.  The cover is glued separately, so the flexing of the pages and spine do not crease the cover.  It's so much better!  When I put this book back on the shelf (and I might not), the spine will look brand new.  This is the quality I provide to my backers!
TIMELINE
SEPTEMBER- After the Kickstarter deadline, I will send out a survey to those who pledged for a hand-drawn portrait. The survey will include information about how to submit your image. As the images come in, I will begin drawing.
JANUARY- If I end up with 400 portraits (that's a lot!), and I draw 100 portraits each month (that's totally possible), I will finish drawing by the end of January.
FEBRUARY- Scanning, cropping, color correcting, rotating, converting to PDF, and compiling for the printer.
MARCH- Submit the files to the printer.
APRIL- It's quite possible to have the books ready for shipping in April.

I've decided to give myself plenty of room in the timeline, though. So I've scheduled the rewards to be delivered by July, just to be safe. I prefer to be months ahead of schedule vs the opposite, and you can see in my previous two Kickstarter projects, everything went out at least on time, if not early. Besides not wanting to let down my backers, it's also very important to me that my students see this project completed. I'm very motivated to stay ahead of schedule.
RULES
Part of the point of this project is to show a wide variety of people and expressions in a constrained format. To that end, I am requesting that you do not send photos of children, pets, or the deceased. I am only interested in photos of consenting adults. That means you, not some guy off the street. You will need to confirm that the person in the photo is either you, or a consenting adult, and that you are allowing me to publish the drawing as part of my book.
It will be the backers' responsibility to contribute a well-lit and clearly defined photo for inclusion in this project, so please do your part! If you send me a bad photo, you can't expect a good drawing. If you don't send a photo at all, I will have nothing to draw.
You don't have to make a funny face, but these little portraits are a lot more fun if you do.
If you would like to see more examples, you can check my website, twitter, tumblr, and Facebook.
Post-it® is a registered trademark of 3M.  This project was originally not endorsed, supported, condoned, sponsored, or otherwise approved by 3M or anyone representing them.  However, since the inception of this project, I have found the people at 3M and Post-it® Brand to be extremely generous and cooperative.  I want to make it clear that this is an independent project, and you should not assume that it is an actual Post-it® product.
3M retains all rights to the trademark.  I make no claims!

Thank you for visiting my project.  I truly appreciate your sharing this with everyone you know who loves animals....or just everyone you know.  :)
Please note the GET ONE, GIVE ONE categories in the rewards listed here.  A great opportunity to own a piece from this collection and give one to a deserving rescue organization.
And the exhibit is set to open on September 26 and the gallery at Prefab, located in The Headquarters in Seaport Village.  This will be an invitation only event, with backers at all levels at the top of the list.
http://kickingitforward.org
Kicking It Forward is a great community of Kickstarter project owners, committed to supporting projects we love. 
HERE'S MY STORY
Hi, my name is Kathleen Waldvogel. I’m a fine art photographer specializing in portraits of horses. I have a small studio in San Diego, California where I create and build large scale pieces using canvas and resin. I feel this gives my images something special and lends a unique, artful quality to my work.
My focus on horses is a natural extension of my personal life. I’ve been riding for years and started leasing my horse, Tobie, about two years ago when I left the corporate world to be an artist. That’s when my camera started following me to the barn. I love my horse, and I know first hand the deep connection and partnership that develops between horse and rider. I am so happy that my work allows me the chance to tap into that energy and emotion, to frame the essence of these beautiful creatures and freeze a moment in time for their humans to treasure.
Because of the strong response I get when I show people these pieces, I want to have my first public exhibit. While my goal is to gain new clients through this exposure to my photography, I knew that a greater purpose could be served. So, this collection is called “Portraits of Hope” and it is focused on rescue and sanctuary horses. With this collection I hope to remind people of the important work being done by these grass roots organizations to save such noble creatures from neglect, abuse and slaughter.
I learn so much from horses every day. Grace, humor, patience, and compassion. And playfulness. When I started shooting photos for this collection I wasn’t sure what to expect and was prepared for it to take time for these subjects to get comfortable with me and my camera. But they needed no time at all, and the trust and love they showed me from the very start made me laugh out loud, and cry. Their caretakers shared stories of their money earning years, and how they were discarded. And then how they were found and brought to their new homes - stories that will appear beside their portraits at the exhibit to allow everyone to get to know a little about their journey, as well as the dedication and loving hands that helped to restore their trust in humans.
This show is all about revealing the beauty and grace of these horses and recognizing the tireless work of volunteers who get them to safety and the life they deserve. With your help, I’ll be able to make this show a reality and share pieces of my work and process with you.
I am thrilled to be building this exhibit and I thank you for any support you can offer.  The rewards I have defined provide an opportunity to participate in this project by supporting the funding, and in turn owning a piece from this exhibit.  The money raised from this Kickstarter project will go to the canvases, printing, framing and materials to finish the final works for the exhibit, as well as the creation and delivery of the rewards. updates.update_content:
Dear friends,
This morning as I reflect on how much I have learned over the past 35 days, I'm thankful for having had this experience.  Here is what I have learned:
1.  You need great (not good) social media chops.  A virtual assistant would have helped to alleviate the stress of constantly Tweeting and posting to Facebook.
2.  Media contacts - I have them now, and if I decide to do this again in a month or two, I think I'll be successful, but having the media in your pocket from day one is essential.

Dear friends,
With less than a day left for my project to get funded, I wanted to take a few minutes to share with you a conversation that I recently had with a friend about my involvement in both equine rescues and thoroughbred horse racing.  He asked if I ever felt conflicted about my interest in racing.
It's a valid question, and not the first time I've been asked.  There are many in the equine welfare community who are against horse racing, and I extend to them my total respect for their views, and their reasons for them.

With a little more than two days left in my campaign, it's a long way to go to cover my goal.  Kickstarter is an all-or-nothing platform.  If I do not reach my goal, none of my backers are charged, no rewards are fulfilled and I am not charged anything, nor do I receive any funds.  It's been an incredible learning experience, and I am truly grateful for the encouragement and financial support of my backers.  With such a gap to cover, rather than stressing out and devoting all of my time to hammering away at promoting my project, I'm just going to see what happens and let it be what it is.  Regardless, I've learned a lot.

Had another amazing day with Team Sherman and California Chrome.  Off to the track this afternoon, but I will post photos and more detail when I get home!
Thanks for all the support, sharing on social media and encouragement.  Whether or not I achieve my financial goal, I feel like a winner all around!
Gratefully,

Thanks to everyone who has backed my project so far.  I truly appreciate the support of friends, family and people I've never met.  Every pledge and every dollar helps to get my project closer to its goal.
With 8 days left I have a lot of ground to cover, but I'm confident!  If everyone can keep sharing this on Facebook, Twitter and with your personal contacts via email, more people will know about the project and have the opportunity to join us. When you do share, remind people of the special updates that I am sending to backers-only, with reports and photos from behind the scenes at Del Mar and Los Alamitos.

It is with a heavy heart that I share the sad news that the beautiful and talented Dance With Fate suffering a life ending injury during his morning workout at Del Mar.  Such a tragic loss for his team, who loved and doted on him, and the entire racing community.
I feel kind of silly saying, "But I just saw him yesterday."  Sharing what is likely one of the last photos of him, schooling in the paddock yesterday at Del Mar.

Jul 1 - FINAL ADD-ON REWARDS IN UPDATE 26: For our final 24 hours, we've added limited edition DODOcases, Picnic Blankets, downloadable episodes of the original series and a live online event with Donald Glover & LeVar... from a boat!
   Jun 27 - MORE HUGE NEWS IN UPDATE 22: We've entered the Top 5 Kickstarter Projects... and the other four (Pebble, OUYA, Pono, Veronica Mars) have ALL offered special new rewards to help us get into more schools! Read more now!
Important updates, in case you missed them:

Hi. LeVar Burton here. You may know me as Kunta Kinte, from ROOTS, or Geordi La Forge, from Star Trek: The Next Generation. 
You also may have grown up with me on Reading Rainbow. 
It was my mother who taught me that, by picking up a book, I could "go anywhere" and "be anything." Ever since Reading Rainbow began in 1983, I have dedicated myself to fostering a love of reading in children, just as my mother did for me. 
Over the past year, I have watched Kickstarter bring communities together to support artists and inventors. Again and again, I have been inspired by watching like-minded people team up to accomplish impossible dreams, and to change the world. 
Now, I am hoping you will join me on my mission: to bring Reading Rainbow back for every child, everywhere.
Together, we can change the lives of millions of children. But you don't have to take my word for it: just keep reading!
I believe that every child has a right, and a need, to be literate. We have a responsibility to prepare our children… and right now, the numbers show that we, as a society, are failing in that responsibility.
And here’s the problem:
And: numerous studies reveal that children who can't read at grade level by the 4th grade are 400% more likely to drop out of high school.
And: as of 2011, America was the only free-market country where the current generation was less well educated than the one before.
These problems won't solve themselves.  Real change will require us all to work together. We cannot afford to lose generations of children to illiteracy. And if we work together, we don't have to.
Through Reading Rainbow, we've been working to solve these problems for over three decades. Starting in 1983, Reading Rainbow successfully used television to turn generations of kids into lifelong readers... with great results.
Of course, when Reading Rainbow began in 1983, we were using television to bring books to kids, meeting them where they wanted to be. In 2014, TV is not that place anymore. Now, we’re trying to reach a new generation of digital natives.
That’s why, two years ago, I launched the Reading Rainbow App for tablets. Building on the basics of the television series, we put hundreds of quality books – and educational video field trips – right in a child’s hands.
The response has been encouraging:
But despite this progress, there are big challenges left to face.
First, not all families have access to tablets. Our goal is to cultivate a love of reading in all children, not just those that have tablets. To reach kids everywhere, we need to be everywhere: we need to be on the web, on mobile devices, on game consoles and on connected televisions. 
Second, a resounding number of teachers have told me that they want Reading Rainbow in their classrooms, where they know it can make a difference. We will provide it, along with the tools that teachers need, including teacher guides, leveling, and dashboards. And with your help, we'll provide it to thousands of disadvantaged classrooms for FREE.
Every Home. Reading Rainbow’s digital collection already contains hundreds of books and video field trips… but with your help, we’ll be able to make the Reading Rainbow library available on more of the devices modern kids use to consume content. Now that we've met our initial goal of $1,000,000, we will be able to launch a new version of Reading Rainbow on the single most-used digital platform: the web. And now that we've reached our stretch goal of$5,000,000, we'll also be able to bring the service to mobile phones, Android, game consoles like XBOX and PlayStation, and set-top boxes like AppleTV and ROKU.
Every Classroom. Together, we want to provide Reading Rainbow to as many classrooms as possible FOR FREE! Now that we've reached our stretch goal of $5,000,000, we'll be able to provide year-long subscriptions in over 7,500 classrooms – and every additional $100K we raise lets us help 500 more!
No matter how much we raise, we promise that every dollar you pledge will bring Reading Rainbow to more platforms, and provide it for free in more classrooms.
We can make sure that millions of kids learn to love reading, but we can’t do it without you. That's why I hope you’ll join me in making a difference!
I believe that spreading the love of reading is its own greatest reward. But if you're going to join our cause, we also have some wonderful prizes. But you don't have to take my word for it... Take a look!
Aside from the signed book, the rewards above will be available to anyone who pledges! 
But we also have several LIMITED EDITION rewards... so be sure to get them before we run out! (And if we DO run out, keep checking back -- we'll do our best to add more when we can!)
Or, if you prefer, you can also pledge for a reward package that will be gifted to the classroom or school of your choice!
And, if you're just interested in Star Trek related rewards, and don't want all of the Reading Rainbow goodies above, we've also got a few special reward levels created just for you:
This Kickstarter – and Reading Rainbow – couldn't happen alone, so I want you to meet the full team behind our Kickstarter.
Everytime I walk into the office, I am reminded that the Reading Rainbow team is made up of passionate, talented artists, producers, engineers, and so many more. Most of them grew up on the show, have families of their own now, and dedicate their working day to improving the lives of the next generation.  
It's an honor to be surrounded by my Reading Rainbow family every day, and we can't wait for you to join us. And if you do, you'll be hearing from several of us throughout the campaign, and after that, in our backer updates. Click on the picture below to learn more about us!

Mission statement:
To provide San Diego with gourmet food on a mobile platform while utilizing local organic produce, local sustainable humanely raised proteins and continually considering the environmental impacts of my services.
The crew
Chef Chris Shinsky A.K.A. The Machine
Chris Shinsky A.K.A. The Machine is ready to showcase his talents and abilities as a Chef on a mobile food platform.  With 14 years of experience in San Diego's culinary industry, he's held the gamut of front and back of the house positions throughout his career to gain thorough knowledge of proper food preparation, health codes and sanitary requirements. Born and raised in San Diego, he's always hoped to someday open his own local small business and now... he's almost there. Chris believes there's a simple concept that can be translated through any type of food... happiness.  He has touched the hearts and taste buds of thousands of people in San Diego over his career with great food and personable service. He's a passionate gardener and having a green thumb is a modest description of his connection with the plant world.  His home based gardens have received endless enthusiasm and interest with the public each season for over 18 years.   Having a professional platform to be able to increase social awareness for the problem of our declining access to fresh local produce and self sustainability would be a life long dream of his.  Whether it's serving tables in a downtown restaurant, catering an event or grill cooking at upscale cafes in Sorrento Valley... Chris has continually exhibited his unique talents and good nature with food and more importantly people.  I'm a technologically hindered individual with limited computer skills who just recently joined the social media bandwagon which is why your support is vital in making my dreams a reality!
Victoria The Healer
Tory is a San Diego native whose passion for health and wellness drove her to become a Holistic Health Practitioner and licensed Massage Therapist.  She fatefully married Chris in September 2012.  Being conscious about overall well-being, Tory's passion for healthy food is as strong as it is for healing and these two go hand in hand.  She'll be assisting in prep, running the register and will occasionally have a massage chair set up at the truck to show off her healing hands!
The assistance of two additional creative, motivated and talented local chefs will be necessary for day to day operations.  Along with pleasing the streets of San Diego, I'm in discussions with multiple business park campuses in the Sorrento Valley area to begin catering on our opening day.
The grub
Local, sustainable and fresh is the foundation of The Machine's menu.  With a larger selection, we'll have the option of creating daily specials and offer even more selections to satisfy your taste buds. I'm going to create a mobile App that will allow ordering and paying at our truck quicker and easier for our loyal patrons. The menu is going to have a North and South of the border theme which fits right in here in San Diego. The North side will have a savory grass-fed cheeseburger, a delicious chicken Machine-wich, and decadant BBQ pulled pork.  On the south side you'll be able to choose from some of the best pollo asada and pork carnitas in SD or a weekly selection of beer battered fish using our finest local brews.  We'll be offering beer battered onion rings, tortilla chips, french fries or a salad as sides. Having such a versatile menu allows us and our patrons to be able to cross over items to create an endless menu for an endless crowd.  To date, I've come up with over 280 specials to offer on our truck and still counting.  We'll be creating gluten free, vegan and vegetarian options as well as be utilizing our local organic produce and humanely raised livestock within 250 miles of San Diego. Food that not only pleases your stomach and mind... but your soul as well. 
Environmental and community improvements
We're going to be:
Utilizing our humanely raised livestock raised within 250 miles of SD
Donating %'s of sales to charities such as the ASPCA
Using as much local organic vegetables I can get my hands on
Sponsoring monthly beach clean up events
Converting our engines into bio-diesel ASAP
Establishing local home based and urban micro-gardens
Contributing to food donation programs
Using 100% biodegradable and compostable paper products
Participating in local youth cooking classes
Creating AS MANY local honey bee hive collectives as possible
The list goes on and on for what I want to accomplish as a small business owner here in San Diego and with your support, I'll be able to achieve all of my goals!
Where you come in!
Initial expenses to commence operation include: 
Primary truck lease - $2,750/month
kitchen rental - $2,400-$3,000/month
Necessary kitchen utensils/equipment - $2,300
Insurances (3) - $780
Website/Mobile App/Logo development - $2,600
Start-up food/commissary costs - $4,200/first week
Rewards fulfillment - $5,000-$7,000 (depending on # of backers)
Media devices and POS system - $1,850
Labor - $2,500/first week
Taxes and fees - $2,212 (8.2%)

        Sum = $29,192
Stretch goal $50,000
Securing the initial funding will allow us to commence food truck operations for the first month.  We'll use the additional funding for upgrades such as a Mobile Facility Support Unit, converting our truck engines to bio-diesel (once owned) and be able to start the green projects mentioned above... IMMEDIATELY.  We'll be able to purchase ALL of the desired kitchen equipment which would speed up our prep process (which is vital) such as a meat grinder, vegetable dicer, food processor, meat slicer, etc.  I would love to be able to have the assistance of a MFSU which would allow us to store backup product and would also provide an additional venue to offer fresh smoothies, frozen yogurt and GrabNGo items.  We're going to do our absolute best to provide San Diego with an honest, reliable and most delicious venue to satisfy your taste buds, hearts and wallets!
Words can't express my gratitude for your support in helping me reach my goal!!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I'm confident that my success as a personal chef and the experience I've gained throughout my career will translate to being a successful small business owner here in San Diego. Challenges arising with running any type of food platform are endless if you look at them as "problems." I've never viewed negative situations that arise as problems, only as opportunities. As a Chef, I have an obligation to provide the utmost personable service, quality product and overall kindness to every last patron. This is a rare quality in any type of business these days and I pride myself on having this come naturally for me. 

I've spent the last 11 months researching the industry, acquiring contacts, obtaining quotes, marketing my truck, developing my business plan and my last step will be securing funding. I have my primary truck and mobile facility support unit picked out, my kitchen equipment selected and an available kitchen space to rent. I've created a versatile menu that can cater to a large demographic and San Diego's eagerly awaiting our grand opening.

The greatest foreseeable challenge that could arise after being successfully funded, but not yet open for service is being over budget. Some examples might be that the costs of my website/mobile App is higher than anticipated OR the truck I have picked out for lease (to date) isn't available. Though these situations are highly doubtful, I'm confident that I'll be able to conquer any obstacle put before me. As setbacks arise, we'll do our best to tackle them promptly and keep you updated on the progress as new milestones are met. 

Thank you everyone for your support, patience and hope to see you soon!

Hey everyone!  I want to graciously thank everybody for your positive feedback and loyal support throughout my project.  Although I may not reach my intended goal, I will in no way let that discourage my efforts to eventually be operating a gourmet food truck here in San Diego.  The "all or nothing" aspect of Kickstarter can be a motivation for backers to ensure the project's success but can also be the main reason for it's failure.  I'm approaching my dream of owning my own business from different angles and might initially start off by catering events and delivering pre-made meals to residents throughout San Diego county.  I'm a pretty happy guy but I'll be an even happier camper once I'm working for myself.
          A few unfortunate events in my life within the past few months haven't made this project very easy.  My smart phone and computer simultaneously crashed two weeks after I launched my project on April 30th and were pretty expensive to fix.  I lost my job on March 3rd and made the decision to launch my project 2 months earlier then I had initially anticipated.  I decided to dedicate 100% of my time and energy into marketing my new business and I've been spending the last 3 months single handily trying to spread the word about my Kickstarter project via flyers, social media and face to face interactions.  My lack of initial funding and experience with social media hasn't made it easy to generate the desired response with reaching my "funding goal" on Kickstarter.  However, I have gained A LOT of fundraising experience, professional contacts, exposure for my new business and have been able to "plant seeds" in 1,000's of like-minded individuals brains.

Thanks for checking out our Phil The Pill Kickstarter Campaign! We’re excited to introduce you to our game, our villain Hank The Stank, our very own Princess Polycorn, the pillbug inhabitants of Pillville and, of course, our hero Phil The Pill. Our goal for this campaign is to raise the necessary funds to complete and launch Phil The Pill on iOS and Android. We look forward to hearing your feedback, thoughts, ideas and suggestions. Let us know what we can do to earn your support!
  Think Bomberman meets Pacman meets Temple Run. Phil The Pill is an immersive, surprising and mildly addicting action/puzzle video game. Players will experience fits of laughter, tears of joy, racing hearts, fits of frustration and above all else, pure fun!
  Welcome to Pillville!  Ruled by the fair Princess Polycorn, Pillville is home to a peaceful colony of kind hearted, fun-loving pillbugs. One such joy filled pillbug is our hero, Phil The Pill! Phil is a pillbug who spends his days rolling ‘round the kingdom, relaxin' with friends and devouring delicious sugary snacks. Pillbugs love their sweets.
Unfortunately, the peace, quiet and serenity of Pillville is under attack!  Hank The Stank, a downright dirty rotten stink bug and his brood of Stenchmen have infiltrated Pillville and are spreading stench across the land.  The poor, defenseless pillbugs have no choice but to retreat into their shells to escape Hank’s nauseating smell. 
Pillville is no longer the joyful paradise it once was. It's a wasteland consumed by vile stink bug stench. Even the once bright and happy Polycorn Palace has been converted into a filthy, pungent bowling alley. Hank The Stank, a fierce, competitive bowler now spends his days on the lanes using frightened, rolled up pillbugs as bowling balls.
Captured and locked in an airtight bowling trophy, Princess Polycorn’s magical powers have been rendered useless and there is nothing she can do to save her kingdom! All hope would be lost, if it weren’t for the severe allergies and clogged sinuses of Phil The Pill! Even Hank The Stank’s aromatic stench cannot infiltrate the stuffed nasal passages of Phil’s nose!
Pillville and it’s sugary snacks have begun to wither and rot.  Phil The Pill, immune to the stench, is our only hope! Be a hero, support our Kickstarter Campaign and help Phil The Pill save Pillville!
At its core, Phil the Pill is a top down action-puzzle maze explorer game. Using intuitive swipes, taps and multitouch gestures you control Phil as he navigates a series of mazes riddled with hazards, traps, tricks and baddies. As you might expect, Phil's main mode of transportation is rolling. Swiping in any direction, Phil takes off, rolling at a brisk pace, till he hits an obstruction. A quick tap stops Phil and brings him to an upright action stance where he can punch or fire off a variety of weapons to bust through walls or take out baddies. Don’t stand around for long though, you gotta keep on rolling on to stay ahead of the creeping cloud of stench that chases you towards the finish of every level!
SAVE THE PILLBUGS
Each maze has 3 pillbugs to save. Saving all the pillbugs isn't required, but come on, have a heart.
SWEEP THE COINS
Coins are scattered generously throughout the levels. Collect them for extra points, equipment upgrades and to use in Bert's Shop.
SEARCH FOR CRUD
Pillbugs love random crud. Many levels have a hidden piece-o-crud. Find them all for bonus loot. 
FIND THE EXIT
Like the ancient proverb says, In order to begin the next level you must first exit the level you are in… Make it to the exit portal to unlock the next level.
Puzzles become less forgiving and more intense as you travel deeper into the game. Choosing a strategic path, conserving your weapons and managing hazards are key to your survival. The following level feature overview will prove useful when strategizing your way through the levels.
WORM HOLES
These holes can be used as secret underground transport paths but beware, there’s no telling where you’ll popup after entering one. You’ll also want to be cautious of the dwellers that occasionally pop out of them! 
LASER GATES & SWITCHES
Each laser gate has a color coordinated switch that must be pressed before passing through it. Running into the gates isn't a good idea, take our word for it!
CONVEYOR BELTS
Conveyor belts are a one way street. They’ll get you moving in one direction, but don’t even think about trying to go back!
 
  STEEL BLOCKS
Steel blocks are impassable. Don't punch or waste your ammo on them. No matter what you do, they won't go away!
GRASS BLOCKS
They might slow you down but they'll never stop you. You can punch right through these blocks!
STONE BLOCKS
These blocks require a little more firepower. Stock up on bombs to clear stone blocks out of your way.
WOOD BLOCKS
Wood blocks are a little too tough for Phils' fists, but any other weapon will blast right through ‘em.
  A variety of destructive weapons will be available when you need them most.
  Don’t underestimate the power of an insect's fists. Phil can punch out enemies, and through dirt walls. Watch out for stone though, it can be a little rough on the knuckles.
  As you may have guessed, bombs go boom! And take out most things in a close vicinity. Bombs can destroy dirt, stone, wood and enemies.
  A basic semi automatic projectile weapon, the pea shooter is handy for ranged shots as well as blasting through dirt, wood and enemies rapidly.
  The missile launcher turns a bomb into a ranged weapon! Use missiles to blast blocks and baddies from a distance.
  Sometimes you gotta fight fire with fire; or in this case, stink with barf. The barf cannon sends a glob of barf over an obstacle where it splats down with nasty force taking out whatever it hits.
  It may be pretty, but the rainbow ray should be used with caution. It has the ability to take out every destructible item in its path in a high-powered laser-like fashion.
  Designed for the most dire situations, the smart bomb has the ability to clear an entire level, leaving virtually no chance for Hank’s Stenchlings to beat you. They’re rare so use ‘em sparingly.
  Life in Pillville has become very difficult and even the strongest Pillbug needs an occasional “pick me up.” As Phil fights his way through level after level, he’ll need power ups to lift his spirits and keep him alive. 
Power ups can be found throughout the game, or are available for purchase in Bert’s Shop using coins you’ve collected along the way. Bert can be a bit of a slimy guy, but he has a knack for being there when you need him most.
HEALTH REFILL
Runnin’ on empty? Fill 'er up and bring Phil’s health back to 100%.
GAS MASK
Gas masks lessen the debilitating effects of the creeping stench cloud. You're nostrils will thank you.
STINK REPELLENT
Take your time, fumigate and relax! This repellent completely removes the stinky creeping stench from the level you’re on.
INVINCIBILITY
The name says it all! This one renders Phil invincible for the remainder of the level.
CRUD FINDER
This handy gadget reveals where hidden crud can be found. Nothing hit's the spot like a little crud!
  If obstacles are opportunities, there are a LOT of opportunities in Pillville! Rescuing a princess, defeating a stink bug and setting a colony of Pillbugs free is pretty hard work when danger lurks ‘round ever corner. Keep on your toes and watch for these hazards.
CREEPING STENCH
This green gaseous cloud is found on every level of the game. As Phil races to collect coins, nab weapons and free his fellow pillbugs, the creeping stench wafts further into the maze, pushing Phil higher and higher on the screen. If Phil can’t complete his mission prior to the level being fully engulfed…  All hope is lost.
SPIKED WALLS

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
One of the biggest challenges with Kickstarting an iOS/Android app is distribution of the game itself. This will play heavily into how we decided to monetize the app initially, whether its Free to Play or a Premium app. Our thoughts are that we are going to need to initially release the app for free. Beyond that, we are really not sure how we should monetize the app for non-backers. We'd like to have an open conversation with our Kickstarter backers about this and try to come up with the preferred approach of the community. 

There has been a lot of controversy lately regarding free to play games and understandably so. Many free to play games are designed around the monetization mechanic and pay walls rather than around what makes for the best possible game. We can assure you that this is not and will never be the intention of Phil the Pill. The indie game industry on mobile is in a state of disarray due to free to play models and we'd love to help push it back in the right direction before its too late. We think it will require a collaboration between players and developers because without the players the developers won't have anyone to make games for! Please help us determine the best way to distribute our game in a way that is good for the players and gives us the financial success we need to continue making more games.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Phil The Pill - Launching on Thursday!
updates.update_content:
Hey Friends! 
Well, it took a little longer than anticipated, but we are finally releasing Phil The Pill this Thursday April 2, 2015! The game has turned out rather amazing, and we really hope you will all check it out. It will be released on the iOS App Store on Wednesday night. 
There are a total of 96 totally custom designed levels plus an extra crazy boss battle against Hank the Stank and all of his Stenchmen! Its super intense, and we can't put it down! Needless to say we think you are going to love it.

Hi Backers, 
I'm sad to see that we didn't make our goal. We feel like we've let you all down. 
Just in case anyone is unclear on how Kickstarter works, this means that any funds that you pledged are returned to you. Kickstarter is all or nothing, and rightfully so! We have learned a ton from running this campaign and feel like next time we will find much greater success. 
Thank you all so much for your support and belief in us. We will not be giving up on Phil the Pill and will continue to self-fund it the best we can until it is ready for launch. We would greatly appreciate if you would follow the project on Twitter and stay connected with us.

Hey Everyone! Just a token of appreciation for everyone that has backed the game so far. We are too excited not to share a little gameplay with you!   
http://curiousmedia.com/philthepill/play/
Disclaimer: This is an early alpha preview/demo, and there are some bugs and things that aren't finished so don't worry too much about that. If you have any trouble playing, don't hesitate to let us know. You will need the Unity Web Player (it will prompt you to download if you don't have it) and the game file is about 56mb so it might take a little while to load. Once loaded it should run like butter! One final note, please play in any current desktop browser besides Internet Explorer.

The closed-captioned version of our project video can be viewed on YouTube.
THANK YOU!
More than two years ago, we started on a journey to find out what both students and hiring managers really need from UX education. Today, because of your support, we’ll turn research into a real school, Center Centre. Also—thanks to you—more than $20,000 has been pledged towards student scholarships. We are humbled by your awesomeness.
This Kickstarter campaign may be over but the Center Centre adventure continues. 
Join our quest! 
Follow our research adventures at the Unicorn Institute. 
Find information about Center Centre on the school’s website.
Keep in touch with @unicorninstitute, @jenseninman, and @jmspool.
STRETCH GOAL #2: Let’s bring on the students.
Scholarship funding time!
Every dollar pledged over $112,000 goes straight to students scholarships. Thank you for supporting the future of UX!
STRETCH GOAL #1: Bring on the school’s faculty.
Thank you!
We did it! You helped us reach $112,000 and now we can bring on Center Centre’s full-time faculty several months ahead of schedule.
Read Update #3 if you want the nitty-gritty of how this $112,000 stretch goal will make Center Centre even more awesome…
IN THE NEWS
We’re excited so many news outlets are interested in UX education!
Enter the Unicorns —The Pulse
Web Apps Raise The Ceiling Above HTML5 As Famo.us Recreates Facebook’s Paper —Forbes
Calling all “unicorns”: User experience design school aims to draw, hone talent; help Chattanooga thrive —Nooga.com 
Chattanooga approved for unique user experience design school —Nooga.com 
Tech minds starting new, diploma-granting school in Chattanooga —Chattanooga Times Free Press
THEC approves UX Design School in Chattanooga —Chattanooga Times Free Press
Episode 60: Jared Spool —Happy Monday podcast 
The Trouble With Unicorns —Squirrel and Moose podcast 
Episode 104: With Leslie Jensen-Inman —Shoptalk Show podcast
.NET Awards Category: Game Changer of the Year —.NET Awards 
OUR GOAL 
Center Centre co-founders: Jared Spool and Dr. Leslie Jensen-Inman
What if you could help shape the future of user experience (UX)? What if there was a place where you could easily find the UX talent you need to hire? What if there was a place you could go to learn all the skills you need to be hired as a UX professional?
Through our years of research, we’ve discovered a significant need for a holistic UX design program for adult learners—a program focused on both technical and interpersonal skills through project-based learning. This is why we’re making a new kind of UX design school called Center Centre.
We’ve already created the structure for the school. Now, it’s time to build the course content.
Create content for 30 courses for a brand new design school in seven months. Ambitious? Yes! Doable? Definitely!
Here’s how we’ll do it: We’ll work through an intensive course design process for each of the 30 courses. Through this process we will determine each course’s: 
learning goals 
assessments 
learning activities 
resources 
The 30 courses will cover topics like:
interaction design 
critique 
user research
leadership 
visual design 
sketching 
mobile integration
facilitation 
copywriting and content strategy 
presenting 
front-end development 
storytelling 
project management
information architecture
COURSE DESIGN BY THE NUMBERS
Create thirty courses? No problem. Here’s what it takes...
Crafting cohesive course content can be quite complicated. We estimate that we will define about: 
180 learning goals 
150 assessment tools 
30 course descriptions 
30 course syllabi 
60 resources 
1 set of guidelines for industry-grade workshops 
1 set of guidelines for team projects 
1 set of guidelines for individual mastery projects 
1 course design taxonomy
Yes, it’s a lot of work. However, with your help, we can secure the resources we need to take this huge step toward making the UX design school a reality. 
WHY CREATE A NEW UX DESIGN SCHOOL?
We’re connecting education and industry.
You might be asking yourself: Why do we need a UX design school? Doesn’t this already exist someplace?
It’s true, you can learn parts of user experience design through a variety of programs, both online and in person. However, it’s challenging to piece together all of the required skills for a UX designer.
We’re creating a holistic program that connects education and industry to bridge the skills gap between what students learn and what industry needs. Our long-term goal is to create a bricks-and-mortar school where students learn the comprehensive skills to earn meaningful jobs in the field of user experience design.
We want to create a school to produce industry-ready UX professionals—otherwise known as “unicorns.” A UX unicorn is the ultimate generalists: a person who has the right mix of hard and soft skills.
We’ve talked with hundreds of hiring managers, UX professionals, and potential students. We’ve read over 60,000 pages of research. And we’ve integrated what we’ve learned into the structure of the school we’re creating. We’ve already accomplished a lot. In fact, we’re already authorized by the State of Tennessee as a diploma granting postsecondary school! 
Our goal is to raise at least $21,700. Your pledge will allow Leslie to focus on the course design process. We’ll hire additional editors and writers to make up our course creation team.
Your contribution will help us change the future of UX education. 
THERE’S A SIGNIFICANT NEED FOR UX PROFESSIONALS
Direct quotes from our conversations with hiring managers.
There are 150,000 UX job listings in the U.S. alone. That’s a lot of jobs. However, many job seekers don’t have the skills needed to qualify for the open UX positions.
Through our research, we’ve found that companies recognize the benefits of staffing their own permanent design teams. User experience designers are an integral part of the business solution. Companies need experienced designers with the right mix of hard, technical skills and soft, interpersonal skills. Companies need people who can jump in on any project at any time because they’re trained in all aspects of user experience design.
BE A PART OF THE STORY
Join our Superfriends!
It will take a lot of us working together to produce better qualified, industry-ready designers. In our organizations, we need knowledgeable and skilled professionals we can easily work with to create exceptional design for awesome experiences.
We’ve talked with many of you at conferences, on Twitter, and even over dinner. After hearing your challenges, we’re crafting a program to meet your needs. It’s up to all of us to invest resources into the next generation of UX unicorns. It’s up to all of us to work together—both in education and industry—to design our industry’s education. Join us at the Unicorn Institute to create a new design school. Together, let’s build Center Centre.
Are you in?
REWARDS
We are truly grateful to have Superfriends—a team of smart and passionate advisors, consultants, and champions—who continue to help shape how we build the school. It will take a team working together to build the right type of learning environment to move UX forward. Many of our Superfriends have gone above and beyond their role and generously donated and contributed their time, talent, and resources to help create amazing rewards specifically for this project.
A quick view of all of our reward levels.
A big thanks to our team of Superfriends who have contributed content! It’s challenging to contain all of the goodness for every aspect of each reward in the pledge column, so we’ve included detailed information about the rewards below. 
Walls of Awesomeness
Once the school is opened (we’re aiming for Fall 2014), we will feature your name on our physical Wall of Awesomeness at the school. We’ll take photos of the wall and post them online.
We will also list your name on our digital Wall of Awesomeness—aka our website—for the entire world to see how grateful we are for your support.
Digital Wallpapers
Three of the finest designers we know—Daniel Burka, Veerle Pieters, and Khoi Vinh—each created Unicorn Institute Digital Wallpaper designs just for you. You’ll get three different wallpapers, each in three different sizes (desktop, tablet, and pocket).
Magical desktop wallpapers by Veerle Pieters.

Veerle Pieters is a Belgian graphic/web designer, author of Veerle's blog, and Duoh! chief of the playground.
